report.summary: "put a cache on watch list" with c:geo
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Have a button in c:geo that put a cache or trackable to watch list.

report.summary: Mistery or multi when final defined should use final instead of set coordinates
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: No description provided.

report.summary: Images from logs
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Logs can have images attached. Currently you can't view them with c:geo.

report.summary: Open GCC from Cachelisting
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: It would be nice, if it would be possible to start GCC in cache view. E.g. over the more menu.

report.summary: Zoom for spoiler images
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I frequently missed the zoom function for spoiler images. Maybe this feature can be added to cgeo#40 (Log-Images) too.

report.summary: Support Spoiler Sync
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Spoiler Sync (http://www.anode.plus.com/spoilersync/) downloads spoiler-images for offline use. There's someone who would love to have support for Spoiler Sync in c:geo. http://www.geoclub.de/viewtopic.php?p=897807#p897807

report.summary: Feature request: support for OpenCaching.com
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: You could add support for this open server, they have free API. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geocaching#Opencaching.com

report.summary: Add event-logtypes to Field Notes export
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Will Attend and Attended, I've forgotten it and will fix it.

report.summary: Improve Offline-Functionality
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: At the moment c:geo is mainly designed for "live-caching", loading nearby caches over the internet. In the last days a lot of people asked me if we could improve the offline-functionality of c:geo. Better performance, up to 4000 and more caches in database (issue #11) Search in offline caches (name, GC-code, owner...) GPX-export

report.summary: Switch signature-auto-insertion on/off
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From facebook: George Markusic I would like to say that I am so happy that someone picked up the support of this application. The only issue I have since the change is my signature. Now when I try to log cache it automatically loads my signature first. I always enjoy putting in a story of my adventure first then add my signature to the bottom. Is it possible to add a feature in a future release where it is an option to have the signature automatically load or you can add it when you want like in the older version. I'll add this functionality.

report.summary: Show cache-notes from gc.com
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: gc.com allows you as a premium member to add notes to a cache. Show (and maybe edit?) of this notes should be supported. I'll add at least reading of cache-notes in the next days.

report.summary: Change log / What's new popup on start
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: We could use my project's code: http://code.google.com/p/android-change-log/

report.summary: Cache information dialog does not provide help manual access
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: This issue applies to version 2.26RC3. The new (or old, depending on your point of view) cache information dialog provides quick access to the compass, but not to the help manual. In contrast, the cache info screen (activity) we had before provided access to the manual. Please add a "?" action button to the cache info dialog. The corresponding manual topic is "c:geo-cache-info".

report.summary: Allow user to clear all saved logs (field note export related)
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When a user goes through the new field now export feature in cgeo in order to upload her or his logs there is an important difference to the existing online log function. In the latter case, cgeo automatically clears a saved log after it has been commuted to gc.com. In the case of export there is no automatic clearing. In consequence, cgeo will reexport old log entries with the next export. While gc.com will sort old entries based on date, the export files will grow as will the internal database. I would like to suggest that the user can clear saved logs from the history or the stored lists. But maybe someone other has a better idea?

report.summary: mapsforge zoom-controls placement
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Try to align mapsforge zoom-controls with google zoom-controls or vice versa.

report.summary: Add mapsforge copyright notice to 'about'
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: No description provided.

report.summary: Copy text from cache-description
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: It should be possible to select and copy text from cache-description (and maybe from logs).

report.summary: Option to "add" an empty geocache
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Please add option for creating an empty cache to the offline database. This way a not c:geo downloaded cache could be managed by c:geo - like waypoint navigation etc For me this use case occurs from time to time: No network access for mobile thus no offline download possible, but hotel lobby provides inet with printing - thus paper-caching ... Non-geocaching.com listed caches - either from opencaching or (like in Konstanz/Germany) tourism caches. The workaround is to edit any other cache and remember which one it was ;-) Bad Idea if I decided to clean the offlined caches before starting trip to new region.... Comments? Best regards - Henning

report.summary: store offline if cache has manual/edited info
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: (Add an option to) automatically store cache for offline use, if anything was changed by the user manually. From time to time I start with a cache just from the live map - and start editing/adding waypoints etc. hitting the back button once too often means to "loose" cache-details. Well actually my added information seems to be stored locally since after finding the cache again all manual added data is back within the description... For this scenario, if a user obviously is doing a cache since data is added: Please store all retrieved data locally - murphy defines that no network is available if cache description is left ;-) Comments? Best regards - Henning

report.summary: sort by date in cache list
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I'm adding an additional comparator to be able to sort event caches by the event date in the list. Sorting by GC code to get the age isn't enough in those cases.

report.summary: Logging activity should have option to edit default signature
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: In the logging activity, there should be an option menu entry to edit the default signature (i.e. to open the settings and scroll to the edit field for the signature).

report.summary: have button to insert log templates (in options)
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: No description provided.

report.summary: strikethrough title of archived Caches
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: in the details view the title should be strikes through if the cache is disabled or archived.

report.summary: Import of zipped gpx files
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Okay, no one else came up with this so far: gc.com sends pocket queries as zip files. Some other woops, such as Locus and GeOrg already directly import zipped gpx files. They register appropriate intents, so importing pocket queries is just a matter of taping on the attachment in your mail client or tapping on the download link on the pocket queries page on gc.com. It would simplify usability quite a lot if c:geo would also support direct import of zip files with gpx data.

report.summary: no pause on parsing if cache exists
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Currently there is a pause between storing 2 caches, if they were parsed quite fast. This is not needed if the cache was already stored locally and nothing was parsed. It only leads repeated pausing without anything done in between.

report.summary: Change from GM to OSM takes a long time. There should be a wait notification
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When you change from GM to OSM it takes a long time. Could you implement a simple "please wait spinning dialog" in between?

report.summary: Include support for LogDumper
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I think it would be a good idea to include support for something like the Log Dumper and Emailer from Tomas Hubalek. I could for example emagine that c:geo offered a user to use that app and send a logfile to the c:geo team in case of exceptions.

report.summary: Direction images should not be downloaded - at least not in advance
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: The crawler spends one third of its time during a "nearby" search on downloading direction images like this one http://www.geocaching.com/ImgGen/seek/CacheDir.ashx?k=CGQN%0a%01%08%5bQR%5c%5eRA. The seem to be meant to replace the direction arrow in the cache list in strange cases where the cache coordinates are not known. Has anyone ever seen such an arrow in his cache list? I don't think we need them and would therefore like to remove th ecode to download those images.

report.summary: Highlight never found caches
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Hi, Would it be possible to highlight caches which have never been found (no "found it" log)? We could add say a star on the map and on the list, or a different color? Thanks

report.summary: Most recent caches (viewed)
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I suggest to have a prominent link to the last recent cache (that is the most recent from cgeopopup or cgeodetail) on the home screen. While caching or debugging, it happens very often to me that I close the application completely (not via home button, but using the back button) and on next start it takes some time to re-find the cache.

report.summary: Zoomable description
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: A request from a user of geoclub.de: Please make the description zoomable (like in Locus).

report.summary: Display NOTE
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When c:geo is started and there is internet connection a NOTE DISPLAY has to be enabled. It will call some "low tech API" on our webpage (api.cgeo.org) and it would get a data back. Something like none to display no note or a note text (with possible date limit to reduce calls or to display note while offline). Example of usage: NOTE: Dates on log are missing due to GC.com change. We will fix it as soon as possible. Thank you. I answered about 50 emails in past 2 days why there are no dates on logs....

report.summary: enable import of opencaching GPX files
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: With a minor modification, those files can be imported. Later, this may need to be factored out to the connectors.

report.summary: Suggestion : Move to other list from cache screen
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: To manage items in our custom lists, you need to open lists in listview mode. If you want to sort items / list through map or after a search, you cannot do it. Please add a row with the list name, if there, into the cache details and add a menu into this cache screen to move to other list (like it already exists on long press in listview). Thanks

report.summary: Feature request : turns GoogleMaps into Streetview
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Could it be possible to add a Streetview mode ? Thanks

report.summary: create static maps when importing gpx
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Caches being imported from gpx have no static maps. If you are traveling to somewhere without data roaming, the static maps would be quite helpful with imported caches. I just have that situation. :)

report.summary: if static map can't be opened, ask for creating it
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: If cgeo can't open the static map, it should not only display this as a toast, but instead ask whether to create the static map now.

report.summary: Please provide help (manual access) on coordinate input
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Currently, the new coordinate input dialog -- which is just great, by the way! -- does not allow users to ask for help. Please add a title row to the dialog containing the usual "?" help action button. The next manual release will contain the corresponding new topic with an identifier of "c:geo-geocoordinate-input". Thanks! -- geocrasher

report.summary: Homescreen Shortcuts
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Feature request: A way to create homescreen shortcuts to specific caches which when clicked, would open c:geo directly on that cache's details page. Something similar to how Google Navigation homescreen shortcuts can be created to immediately start navi gating to a given address.

report.summary: Double-tap Google Maps to zoom in
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Feature request: enable double-tapping the Google Map view to zoom in. Currently this works with OSM maps.

report.summary: have link from hint section to spoiler images
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: If spoiler images are available, there should be some kind of link to open them from the hint section of the cache details page. I suggest to have a right aligned picture/photo icon in the cache section, if spoiler images are available. Tapping that icon would then open the spoiler images activity, similar to the options menu. The user experience would be better (I regularly miss spoiler images), and for typical hints the additionally used space on the screen would be neglectable.

report.summary: Bring back "insert datetime" in logging menu
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: C:geo used to have "insert datetime" within logging menu. It's possible to bring it back? Thanks.

report.summary: Sort by status
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Will be nice if it is possible to sort list by status (active, disables, archive) so it is easier to delete archived caches from list.

report.summary: Disable map tracking when dragging
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When the user drags the map, the position tracking remains on. This leads to confusion as the user drags the map, and then it jumps back to centre on the current position. This happens both with Google Maps and OpenStreetMaps. I think that c:geo's maps should follow the standard set by the Android Maps app, which is to disable tracking as soon as the user starts dragging the map. In a related note, I also feel that it would be nice if c:geo followed the Google Maps approach of putting the "tracking button" on the action bar instead of a floating button on the top corner of the map.

report.summary: Move tracking toggle button to actionbar
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: in Issue #328 @cachapa suggested additionally to move the tracking toggle button to the action bar. This issue should allow to discuss this new feature seperately (it is in part discussed in #123 as well) Comments copied from #328: @cachapa: In a related note, I also feel that it would be nice if c:geo followed the Google Maps approach of putting the "tracking button" on the action bar instead of a floating button on the top corner of the map. @SammysHP: +1 for both. A more descriptive icon than the blue dot would be good, too. @koem: +1 for both! @Bananeweizen: Regarding the button placement: I'm not sure if the action bar is the best place. Currently this seems like a good solution. But I can imagine that we may have some additional controls in the near future (e.g 3 buttons instead of 1), then the action bar might get quite crowded. For instance, there are several applications for tracking your sports races which typically have multiple overlay controls directly on the map. @cachapa: In my view, if there's still space in the action bar, we should put it there. If at one point the action bar becomes crowded, this can be re-evaluated. The platform's UI guidelines should be followed whenever possible, which in this case means following the Google Maps app. In fact, I propose that the icon from Maps be adopted, as it will be the less confusing for new users.

report.summary: Real Reverse Geocoding
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: It will be great to add "Reverse Geocoding" capability on waypoint. On a waypoint you could get address to go then easily with car ! I saw the field cache_location but it seems to be parsed from html page. I thought about a real revgeocode function using coords. Then, there are several ways to manage offline, because coords could be updated in offline mode! see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/472313/android-reverse-geocoding-getfromlocation

report.summary: Cache static map for own waypoints
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: The static maps can help when being offline. It would be nice to have the static map for the waypoints created by the user.

report.summary: waypoints overview map
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: It would be nice to have a waypoint overview map of the cache details page like we have an overview of the stored caches from the stored list.

report.summary: list of your friends
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: How about a list of your friends. The list could show you how many caches they have found and on selecting one of them you could see the caches they found. The data for this is present on the website so mirroring it to the phone is quite logical to me. Would be nice to get this for easier comparison. Optional being able to add friends from this would be nice to have as well.

report.summary: compass should point to the direction initially
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When the compass is invoked, it slowly rotates to the right direction. That may be a nice animation, but I just want to know where to go. Therefore the initial direction should be correct instead of "animating" towards it.

report.summary: have number of caches in list selection
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Currently the cache list shows the list name and number of caches in the title. If you select another list, it only shows the titles of the other lists in the selection, but we could also have the number of caches in brackets for each list.

report.summary: google-translate cache title / description / logs
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When in other countries, the description mostly isn't in english or your mother language. Normally you cannot go caching then. c:geo should support a translation (e.g. by google translate) which will then be displayed instead of the original texts. After cache refreshing the original texts can be displayed again. Design like this: Choose to translate from menu - all texts will be translated, stored and shown. A progressbar is shown: "translating title, translating short description, translating long description, translating log entry 1/12, ..." Workaround could be #128 - copy text, go to google translate

report.summary: Show my position in static map
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Static maps can be very valuable, when caching abroad (as data roaming is too expensive to be used). But the static maps are not very useful, as long as they do not show my own position. The Windows Mobile caching app "GCzII" has static maps, which show my position (of course allways updated, when I move). IMO c:geo should have this as well.

report.summary: turn off stand-by mode in list view
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Bernd Schreck sent me a mail with this ft. request: Hello everyone, while driving in the car (I am using my smartphone in a fixture) in an area with stored caches, the stand-by mode of the device in list-view is quite annoying. This year I used a "holiday caches"-list for our holiday destination area in order to see caches "approaching" on my route. To keep the "holiday caches"-list displayed (meaning to prevent the stand-by mode) on the phone I had to fiddle all the time with my fingers on the display. Improvement proposal for the list-view: ---> Additional option in the list-view to prevent (i.e. enable) stand-by mode. Currently the list-view provides already a menue with "Options" that leads to "Map" and "List". The new proposed option "Stand-by mode ON" i.e. "Stand-by mode OFF" could be implemented (added) there. Hope you ll like my proposal and implement this characteristic. Regards, Bernd

report.summary: Support waypoint projection
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: It would be a nice feature to support waypoint projection. It can be helpful to get the first waypoint from the cache origin and/or to calculate another waypoint from an existing.

report.summary: Allow to toggle phone gps state directly in c:geo
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From german geoclub forum: As the internal GPS consumes much power it is advisable to switch it off when not directly needed during longer caching tours. It would be convenient to be able to toggle its state in c:geo directly (something many location-related apps allow)

report.summary: OC Nodes API - feature request
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: OC Nodes http://opencaching.eu has own common API (it is not GarminCaching site !!!) Project home API is http://code.google.com/p/opencaching-api/ It will be nice use common API OC Nodes. At current API is installed on 3 sites but next will be add in short time http://www.opencaching.pl/okapi/ http://www.opencaching.us/okapi/ http://www.opencaching.org.uk/okapi/

report.summary: Edit "Personal Cache Note" and copy from it
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: It is very nice, that c:geo shos the "Personal Cache Note". Additionally it should allow to edit it. And (even more important), it should be possible to copy text from it, e.g. copy coordinates and create a waypoint from them

report.summary: Select list for storing caches
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Add menu item "store to list" when viewing, say, a set of search results. With a choice of existing lists or a new list

report.summary: I'd like to be able to search for caches fulfilling several criterias at once
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: E g i'd like Search to be able to find caches near Vitabergen, Stockholm, Sweden with trackables currently in place, but excluding any that have already been found by BengtB. This could be done by having radio buttons at each type of criteria for "exclude/include" and a single search query start link for all conditions specified, plus temp cache type selector for that single search.

report.summary: Map title should describe what is shown
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Currently there are several situations where the map title is something like "Map [10]". Instead it should be more descriptive like "GC12345" or "Caches around GC12345 [n]" or "Live Map [n]" or "Berlin [n]" (assuming that we just searched for "Berlin").

report.summary: A few improvements to logging caches
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: These should maybe be added as separate issues, but I guess they are small and easy, so they can probably be tracked here. a) Logs should be auto-saved (but ofcourse not posted to gc.com) when pressing "back". One time too many I have written a long log, and accidentally pressed "back" and had to write it all over again. Maybe add a "clear"-button (with prompt) to clear the log field if anyone ever wants to delete everything they have written without having to long press -> select all -> delete. b) Signature should be placed below cursor position. Currently the cursor is placed at the bottom, below the signature, when i start logging which is usually not what at least I expect. c) Logs on cache page does not show all (unicode) characters. I guess this has to do with either the font used, or Android per se, so it might not be an easy fix. You can add a number of unicode-chars to your logs by using the html entities (IE ✐). They show up fine on the web (gc.com), but not on the phone, where they are simply displayed as squares. It would be great if the font used in the app was able to show more of these characters.

report.summary: Support also Androzic
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Also the mapping app Androzic is very useful (especially when you have OziExplorer maps). It would be nice, if c:geo could support it.

report.summary: cache type "unknown"
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: As discussed in 00a58e7, we need an additional cache type "unknown" including a set of icons for that type. Implementation of the code is easy, I need someone to create those icons.

report.summary: sort history by *my* viewing date
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: when I call up the history of caches in g:geo, it is isually sorted alphabetically. sorting by 'date' sorts by some obscure date I cannot make out. I would love to have it sort by the last time I viewed that specific cache in c:geo (sorted reverse, ie last cache first) It should not be too hard to store the last time a cache was viewed in memory and use that as sort date.

report.summary: Default handler for mime type application/gpx+xml
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: It would be great if c:geo was set as a handler for mime-type "application/gpx+xml", and would try to add these to stored caches automatically.

report.summary: Offline logging batch submit
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Would be nice if you can add an "batch" submit option for the offline logs. When you save a offline log it doesn't save the gcvote rating.

report.summary: Refresh only logs
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Not that logparsing is simple and a request was made on FB. Can we have refresh log only. People have some caches stored in list and they would like to have only logs updates. This should be simple and fast operation.

report.summary: disable base.getRating() for non GC caches
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Ability for getting the gcvote rating should be part of the connector, so non GC caches are not send to gcvote.com. (I'm basically waiting for the network changes to be merged, afterwards this can be implemented easily).

report.summary: Twitter text not customizable
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: All the texts for sharing are currently hardcoded in the app. They are neither localized nor customizable. If they were customizable in the settings, the localization wouldn't be an issue at all. This is at least an issue for these different actions: twittering cache twittering trackable sharing cache

report.summary: Have only one link for (multiple) log images
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: As discussed in #553, there should only be one photo icon and a concatenated label in a log entry of the cache details, if multiple images are available. With the changed handling, all images are opened anyway, so multiple links are no longer necessary.

report.summary: Display images in the details views
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: As discussed in #553 I'd like to add image support for images associated with a cache (spoilers and images from the image gallery) as sometimes this helps a lot :) I plan to add a new section in the details view similar to the trackables section. The image will be loaded and displayed when the user clicks on an image (similar to the trackables). Any suggestions how I can determine the image urls because there is no direct connection from the cache data to the images. The image gallery has to be parsed at first.... What about - for a first version - a new menu entry that opens the images in the browser if there are any images associated with the cache ?

report.summary: When logging a found "offline" its still shown as "not found" on the map
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Handling this would be a big improvement in usability. When you are on a caching trip and log many caches offline, its rapidly getting confusing regarding what caches have been visited and what haven't. Regards, Rev

report.summary: Upload field Notes directly to GC.com
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: ... would be a nice feature....

report.summary: show live map as list
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: It should be possible to switch to a list view from the live map. That would make it handy to first select a map piece with certain caches, then show them as list and store only a selection of them. Now I have instead choosen a map area with 102 caches, but I only want to store about 30 of those. There is no way to do this currently. It only works by storing all and afterwards deleting.

report.summary: rename list
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: There is currently no way to rename an existing list.

report.summary: Store cache from context-menu in list-view
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: An entry for deleting a cache is already there, but not for storing it.

report.summary: Put changelog before contributors in the "About c:geo" screen
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: This will probably hurt our collective and individual prides, but I suggest that we move the "changelog" section of "About c:geo" above the "contributors" section. I am afraid the new changes interest the users more than the list of contributors. Any objection?

report.summary: Use enter key to invoke action in one line input fields
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: If you input a keyword in the keyword search and press the return key, the focus jumps to the next input field (or the button, depending on the Android version, as it seems). And this is the same for mainly all other one line input fields, which have a button to invoke an action using the value of the input field. I suggest to instead directly invoke the button action when pressing the enter key in the input field. (And when doing this refactoring, the IME_ACTION_GO should also invoke the same action). Anybody with different opinions?

report.summary: cgeo Accoustic navigation
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From email: Dear cgeo-developers, since some months we use cgeo with our HTC Desire HD - thanks at this point for you great work!!! Before (and still now) we use a HTC Touch Pro2 under WinMobile 6 and the software "gatecacher" (by Dennis Baremans). This software has one feature that works perfect when approaching a cache (especially by bike): at certain distances (every 50m from 950 to 150m, every 10m from 150m to 50m, every 5m from 50m to 10m and then every meter) they are given by playing these predefined sounds (wav-files) together with the current angle (also as sound). Sounds for distances larger than 950m are not available but from time to time the current angle is spoken. This wonderful feature unfortunately no Andoid-GC-Software consists of as far as I know It would be wonderful if in any future cgeo could get something like this. Yours Uwe

report.summary: cache-icon with symbol on Maps for caches with local log
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: It would be nice if you at the icons on the map to which a local log exists a symbol (like the smiley when logged only one other color) would appear. Sorry for the bad English, was translated with Google translator.

report.summary: Copy Waypoint's
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: It would be a nice feature to copy Waypoint's in one Cache. In many multi-caches you get at one station the coordinates for the next station. Can copy a waypoint with the ability to quickly create new waypoints

report.summary: Mark stored caches on livemap
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: It would be very nice to have a way to visualize that a cache on livemap also is stored/available offline. Use of different border colour around the cache icon could be a solution. Maybe different intensity or different colour dependent on the time since it was last updated.

report.summary: show waypoints on livemap only works if header is in range
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I like the new feature "show additional waypoints on live map", but: if the header is coming out of range, the waypoint disappeares... respectively if header ist far away, the e.g. "Final" will never appear... the 2nd thing about this new feature: I find a waypoint on the livemap, klick on it, lets say it is named "final", an i dont know, which cache it belongs to....

report.summary: Add Smilies when logging
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: The gc.com logs are supporting various smilies with codes like [:)]; [:D] Full list on gc.com logpage "Insert Smilies". It would be a nice feature if c:geo would support these smilies as well via menu. This could be located in the menu of the logging-view "Insert"/"Smilies" / Scrollist of smilies. I dont know, if the icons used on gc.com are under some copyright, if not they could be used in that menu to visualize the smiley.

report.summary: create waypoint based on cache coordinate
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I currently need to have a waypoint created based on a distance and angle from the cache coordinates. I see no way to create this easily in c:geo. We can only create such waypoints based on manually entered coordinates or based on my current coordinates. Therefore I suggest an additional button "Cache coordinates" in the coordinate input dialog, which works similar to the "my coordinates" button.

report.summary: hide some options menus for empty list
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: We currently have 7 main menu items in the options menu of cache lists. As only 6 are shown at a time, we always have "Map" and "List" under the "more" button. This is even true for an empty list. There you see 3 disabled menu items, but you have to use the "more" button to get to the list management so you can delete the empty list. I suggest that for empty lists (and only for those) the disabled menu items are also hidden to avoid clicking through multiple menus.

report.summary: Don't hide my found caches when viewing other cachers founds
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: For me it doesn't make sense to hide the caches already found by me in the list of founds by others (clicking on a user or owner name) despite having it enabled in the configuration. This should only apply to normal search on live map or nearby search. Thanks

report.summary: Give favorite point to cache
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Give a favorite point to cache from c:geo. Request from FB

report.summary: Use C2DM for "Send to c:geo"
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: How about using http://code.google.com/android/c2dm/ for "Send to c:geo"? - that would avoid using your own servers and manual polling.

report.summary: Send2cgeo load multiple caches on one click
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Hi, It'll be great when cgeo can load many caches on one click, it could be implemented same way as waypoint download from geocaching.com search results. If it is possible to add button there It'll be useful. Thanks I'm not so good in javascript so I had tryed but I can't do that.

report.summary: Add special color marker in list of stored caches for solved caches
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From facebook: I have a feature suggestion. I like to solve Unknown/mistery caches but usually when solved I don't go there to log for long time (some times I even forget them forever). So I would love an option to filter the Stored caches to easily find the ones I solved, maybe by filtering the ones with custom placed waypoints as I usually store there the final coordinates. Maybe just having an option to custom mark them in the list, something like the orange bar placed beside the caches found but not yet logged or the green one for the solved. Maybe a Blue or Violet bar? I don't really know what's the best way but it will be a very usefull addition anyway :D

report.summary: Ask before drop cache (from detail-view and from list-context-menu)
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: At the moment if you select "delete cache" from the context menu in the list-view the cache will be deleted without confirmation. The same in the detail-view, but there you can click again at "store" as long as you don't go back to the list.

report.summary: Resume refreshing after FC
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From email: I still offering feature "RESUME" The idea for Manage -> Refresh All. After every succsessfull cache downloading put its number (just number in cgeo, not the name) into some file at the disk. If in time of download cgeo is crashes, user could start cgeo againg, then choose Manage -> Resume Refresh All to start downloading not from the 1-st cache, but from last downloaded. As I see it will be a solution for this issue. Every can download GPX file, and Refresh it again and again :) This is something between bug, refactoring and future request. What do you think?

report.summary: have number of caches after "load more caches"
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: The button to load more caches after a search is currently labeled "load more caches...". Instead it should be something like "load more caches (123 currently)". Otherwise there is no easy way to see how much the list already contains, if the title label is long.

report.summary: have explicit option for trail on map
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Currently the trail display on maps is always active and can only be disabled via options menu for that session. We should have a normal option for the trail display to not force users to disable it again and again.

report.summary: Verbose cache loading should also work for Refresh
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I like the additional info while loading a cache (so I know, that really something is giong on). But when I refresh a cache, no verbose info is shown (so I still don't know, whether anything is going on).

report.summary: Nearby List also for non-GC caches
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I don't know whether this is a bug or a feature request: Import opencaching GPX for a certain location Open nearby list while at this location Only the nearby GC caches will be listed It seems imported non-gc caches are only visible/listed on live map. From users perspective he would like to see any cache which is nearby independently if it is GC or non-GC.

report.summary: Parse cache data from html file
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: As far as I've seen, cache data for offline use is currently either spidered online from the gc website or imported from gpx-files. Have you already thought of importing cache data from the saved html-page of a cache detail site? You would save the cache detail site as html page, put it in the .cgeo folder on the sdcard and let cgeo import it from there without contacting the gc site at all. This way, the gc site would not be spidered with your login data and you do not have to create a pocket query. You just open the cache you like in your browser and use the "Save Page" - "Html only" feature of the browser. Of yourse, this is only practicable if you don't want to import dozens of caches. But for getting the details of a few caches this is a fast and secure method. (I got the cgeo source code and did a proof-of-concept implementation, which works great for me. I did not create a pull request because I possibly have overlooked something in the implementation and because I'm new to the git cvs and the whole project).

report.summary: Scanning of TB-codes with external app ?
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Just today a strange idea came into my mind and I want to ask you about your opinion and about the general feasibility: Since some weeks you implemented the import of QR-Codes via QR-Droid,etc to scan GC-Codes. When selecting this feature it also allows me to open Google Goggles. This made me think about the following: I tried Goggles to read a Travel Bug Dog Tag and it worked, that it delivered back the TB-code from the tag. Would it be possible to allow scanning of the code and opening the TB-page with it ? Just today I went again to a TB-Hotel with >10 Bugs and most of them without description of the goal. So I had to input each code manually into the c:geo search to look them up. I dont really know if scanning is faster, but if Goggles is working reliable it could save a lot of manual input (and its a really sophisticated feature :) )

report.summary: ask for restore if database is empty
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: If the database is empty at startup and there is a backup available, the app should ask the user if he wants to restore it.

report.summary: History of Navigate any Location does not allow navigation other than compass, no edit
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: This is a request for frontend improvement: the "navigate any location" activity has a history of past locations entered. However, its use is currently rathing limited. In particular: the user can only delete a history waypoint or navigate using the compass. the user cannot navigate any other method, such as maps, et cetera. A long tap on a waypoint brings up only the option to delete. the user cannot recall a history waypoint. My suggestion is to change the activity as follows: when the user taps on a history waypoint, its coordinates get transferred to the input field. No navigation is done yet. the user then may choose to edit the waypoint or navigate using the same methods as when entering a new waypoint. the existing "shortcut" of tapping on a history waypoint and navigating by compass should be removed as its use conflicts with easy recall, editing, and navigating by other means.

report.summary: Refresh not stored caches
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Until a few weeks ago it was possible to refresh not stored caches by clicking on "refresh. Now this doesn't do anything.

report.summary: show date for event caches in cache list
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Normal caches show the size in the cache list. Event caches don't do that. But they could show the date instead. Currently it is not possible to get a clue of when an event cache happens, you must open the cache details for that.

report.summary: Ability to manually update spoiler images
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Hello, after loaded a cache list from a GPX file, it should be useful to manually add some spoiler images inside the folder sdcard/.cgeo/cachename unfortunately, after this operation, cgeo doesn't seem to use/see the new images stored. please add some kind of feature/command that will allow cgeo to update caches spoiler/reference adding or updating them taking the files from inside the folders thanks

report.summary: Parallel installation of Market and Eclipse version of c:geo
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Testing and developing with Eclipse overwrites my Market version of c:geo - i can't use the automatic update anymore because the Market version is signed with a different key than my Eclipse version.... Normally i use my personal, latest build when i am on a cache tour to find bugs... In case of bugs this can be very annoying and i need a fallback to the Market version. I have to deinstall c:geo and download it again from the market.... A parallel installation of the Eclipse (developer) version of c:geo would solve this problem. While developing we could use a different AndroidManifest.xml than for the release build. Your opinions about this ? And: how does Android distinguish two different applications ? Name of the apk file ?

report.summary: Audio recording from cache log activity
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When I was caching today, I played with the Android sound recorder on the way back home from the cache (to record a "voice log"). I suggest to make that an official integrated feature: Have a new menu item in the visit activity to record audio (which just invokes the native audio recorder). When the audio recorder closes, it returns a content URI for the recording. We would need to save that with the cache (and change the DB for that). Playback of the recording could be invoked from a second menu item in the visit activity or from the history. As the audio stuff is handled by the recorder, we don't need additional permissions. Example code: http://www.openintents.org/en/node/114

report.summary: View users TB-inventory
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Feature request: I would be good to have an option to see the list of TBs which are currently in the hands of the user and open the detail page from there. Use Case: Sometimes I want to look up the goals of the TB i currently have with me. The only possibilty is to use the search for each TB which means I first have to lookup the tracking code every time. Also in the log view the TBs are ony listed but not linked to the TB-details. On http://www.geocaching.com/my/default.aspx there is a list of the users inventory, which could be used to make a inventory list also in cgeo. This could be a new menuitem in search and there could also be a link from logview to open the listed TBs detail page.

report.summary: disable spell checker
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: For some fields the spell checker (with the suggestions) should be disabled. I've now implemented this for the trackable code in the search and in the trackable logging action. Any further edit texts where this would be useful?

report.summary: Extend waypoint context menu
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I would like to have an extended context menu for the waypoints in the new details: compass navigate (and sub items)

report.summary: Moving caches to other lists
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: In Live-Map-mode I can use "show as list" and I can save the caches to the "default"-list. I can't directly save caches to an other list. I can't even move caches, that are already saved on the phone! I always have to go "saved" to move caches around. :( Even in detail-mode, there is no way to put the cache to a specific list. I alway have to go to the list and have to move it from there. With 500 caches in a list, it is REALLY hard to find the specific cache again, when you memory is as old as mine :) Please make it possible to move a (already saved) cache to specific list.

report.summary: Waypoint sorting
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: With the current RC I have seen in GC3853R, that the WPs are not sorted according to their name or short name nor sorted acc. to the website sequence. I don't know, how the implementation works, but the cache above shows, that it might need improvement ?!

report.summary: Readability improvement for Cache Description
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: For GC288FW the cache-description is in blue color. Nevertheless the readability improvement (change of background color) is not working here. For my opinion descriptions with this color should also be improved for readability by c:geo.

report.summary: Autofill trackable code
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Open search Search for a trackable with a tracking-code Post a log to grab it You must enter the code again I'm not sure how difficulty it is to implement this because I never looked into the trackable code, but this would be a helpful feature.

report.summary: Display save state in map view
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When I'm on a quick caching tour somewhere I usually look on the live map, select a few caches (thanks to the new overlay mode that displays more info on the cache without that the details have to be opened!) and save them to the local list. What I'm now missing though is a small visual indicator that I already saved a particular cache, especially in regions with many caches, so I don't accidentially click on such a cache again and try to save it.

report.summary: click preview map to invoke navigation
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: What do you think about showing the navigation menu when clicking the preview map? I'm not sure, but I think it was that way in the old version, too.

report.summary: Navigon support
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: requested on facebook

report.summary: Show day of week for events
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: in cache details and in special event list mode

report.summary: replace term standard navigation
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: although this is implemented since several days, I'm still not used to the term standard navigation. reading it in the menu, I always have to think about what is my standard navigation. Therefore I suggest to use the name of the tool again, e.g. compass.

report.summary: send to c:geo missing in search nearest
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From our facebook group: I need a button in the overview of a pq for example to send the cache directly to the device. Like the two on the rigtht site for "send to gps" and "add to tour" from the GCTour-script. I had have already a look into the script but the search nearest page is to different to the other pages....

report.summary: Drop found
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: There are two options I would like to see. The first one is to "drop found" so I only need to store the unfound caches and do not need to go through lists of found caches when I first go out in the morning. The other option is to allow this as a filter.

report.summary: Map rotation
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Hello, fist of all I will thank you for the great program. When I go caching I miss always one thing: I still use the map for navigation. It would be easier to read the map to be connected with the compass so that the map is rotated to the direction I have to go. Greetings, Taneller

report.summary: Show log-images also for TBs
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: c:geo is supporting pictures in logs already for caches..maybe this could also be applied for TB-logs ?

report.summary: TB-seach from homescreen not possible with secret code
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From a friend: I tried to use the search function on the top of the homescreen to log TBs I have found. The help-app says, this should work. However it seems only to be working if you use the public identifier of the TB but not with the secret code printed on the TB. This makes this special function quite useless, as usually I don't have the public code when I find a TB and try to log. It would save some clicks if I could just use the secret-code in search from the homescreen.

report.summary: Working mode of unreliable marker
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I just tried out c:geo NB with a basic member account. If I have seen it correctly all the caches on live-map (except the caches stored on the device) will appear with non-reliable marker. I know, that the reliability can only be checked if the user is PM. Assuming that this functionality will go to the market, I guess that many basic-member users will not understand why the caches are marked as unreliable and will probably not like this feature or even don't trust the app anymore. The change to look-and-feel is to drastic. In fact in most cases the caches shown to basic-members will have reliable coordinates anyway, but we just cant detect that right now. I hope, that I understood the the working-mode of the reliable-check, if not please correct me and/or close this issue. After having seen the look-and-feel for basic-members I would like to suggest to think over the display of reliability in the following way: For premium members only mark unreliable by a orange-circle and reliable without marker (like currently implemented) For basic members only mark reliable by a green-circle and unreliable without marker Doing it in this way each type of user would only get notified by a marker in important cases on his user-perspective and not be overwhelmed by a lot of caches marked in some way. What do you think ?

report.summary: Change icon in map for caches with offline log
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Imagine there are several similar caches located in a small area. All are saved in a list, but the names are long with a appending number. So they are hard to distinguish. On the map started from the list all look also the same because they are of the same type. Now during the cache tour every cache is logged offline as found (or DNF) and in the list they are marked. But on the map they look still similar. It would be an improvement to "mark" them also on the map. Maybe an overlay or a slightly changed color could do it.

report.summary: Define types for custom waypoints
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: It should be possible to give custom waypoints also a type attribute. For a cache with only custom waypoints for parking, stages and final they are all displayed just as waypoint. At the map the waypoint could then also have the icon for parking or final.

report.summary: Connector between cache and final waypoint in map
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Imagine "some" solved unknown caches that are displayed on the map together with it's final waypoints. Because the finals don't have to be close to the cache it's hard to know what final waypoint belongs to which cache. A connection in the map between cache and waypoint could be a good way to show they belong together. Making the connections visible / invisible from the menu would be helpful too.

report.summary: Downloading photo gallery
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When doing update of already saved offline cache, is it really necessary to download photos again? It's problem especially with caches which requires to post photo with the log, like earth caches. The result is downloading a lot of photos, which takes a lot of time. But the photos are already downloaded once, so why download all of them again and again?

report.summary: more details on results when searching by address
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Sometimes the search by address can give more results than expected, e.g. searching for "Steinbach" which exists multiple times in Germany. Several of those addresses are shown completely identical, e.g. "Steinbach, Germany". It would be nice to have some further differentiation between those addresses. As there are in fact no more additional details in the address returned by the geocoder, we can probably only add current distance and maybe geographic direction (e.g. "123 km SW").

report.summary: show geocode in history
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I nearly always log offline and then use the PC afterwards for logging. For that use case it would be quite comfortable if the second line of the history list entries would not only contain date and time, but also the geocode, so you can more easily search the logged caches online (without opening each of those caches).

report.summary: Marker for changed Coords in Cachelist
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: On the Map there is a Marker for Caches with changed Coords (red flag). It would be nice to have also a marker in the listview of caches.

report.summary: HINT shown in details window
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Hi, can you add hint to details window? Now it is located in Description window and it is not optimal... you have to move between windows and hint is located below the long text so you must scroll down long time... it is uncomfortable... You should add hint to details windows too... It would be great! Sorry for my bad english :) Thank you

report.summary: Ignore settings when searching for own caches
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When on the search page and the menu button is hit a search own caches option appears. However, if the user has selected that they want to hide their own and found caches in the main options menu, this search returns nothing making it completely useless. To get this to work, the user has to disable that main option first before going to make this search.

report.summary: Import querys direct from Geochaching.com
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: It would be nice to import querys direct from Geochaching.com

report.summary: Better styled spinners
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: We have now two 'Spinners' (drop-down selectors) in c:geo (map source selection, waypoint type) and may get a third (units selection for projection). Currently these are in standard style. We should adapt them to our theme. I started this already for the waypoint type, but as this got quite involved I choose to make it a separate issue.

report.summary: Ask before drop
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: On offline map (stored, show on map) in popup, "more details" and "drop" are really close together. Drop should ask "are you sure"? Caching 4h of walk from nearest GSM signal and if you press "drop" in a long walk there.

report.summary: "Send to" for the text fields in cache details
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Now that we have the possibility to translate several fields of a cache, it would also be nice to invoke arbitrary apps with those texts (maybe a different translation app, the mail app, ...). Therefore we should have another menu item in that context menu of text fields similar to the "Send to" menu of the cache itself (using "text/plain" as mime type in this case).

report.summary: Second navigation method also for long click in menu
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Currently this new feature is only used for the action bar. For intuitive use it should also be available on long click in the cachedetail menu and maybe also represented by another icon in the background. I like this feature because I use radar and map equally but I almost never use the actionbar to start the activity but the menu.

report.summary: Sort by logging-state
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Would be nice, if it would be possible to sort a list by the logging-state. For example good for offline-logs, to easy find the logged caches. Maybe two-step sorting: first by state, second by time? Thanks

report.summary: check GPS enabled state
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Since a while I have a phone with Android 2.3.6 which allows enabling/disabling GPS very easily from the status bar. I now have it disabled by default (so Facebook and other apps can not track my position), but always forget to activate it for c:geo and then wonder why the position is not updated. We really need to have a check in the tool whether or not GPS is enabled (at least when entering the map) and to notify the user or to activate it by ourselfes then. Not sure if there are duplicates for this, I didn't find one with the quick search.

report.summary: Configurable directory for "Import GPX"
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: my c:geo version is 03.01 RC2, running on a Samsung Galaxy SII with Gingerbread 2.3.3 When I select "Import GPX" from the Import menu c:geo scans my complete SD card (actually both cards because the SII has internal storage which gets mounted as "sd" card and place for an second card as well). Scanning all that storage takes 5-10 minutes. I'd like to set the directory c:geo looks into for PQ's, usually I am pretty well aware where I (actually, the dropsync client) put my PQs on the SD card.

report.summary: Setting for static map download on gpx-import
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: A feedback of some friends who are using the nightly builds: I import a lot of gpx-files with quite high amount of caches (sometimes up to 500). The import is OK with the new version but it takes ages because it downloads static-maps which I use only rarely. I would like a setting to switch it off for gpx-import to save time. If I switch off the general setting for static-maps I can also not use them for all other caches and I am also not asked whether I want to download them on access. I think a lot of users will run into this "problem" and in addition the Map-API will give up after 1000 requests (which is easy to reach already with 200 caches also containing some waypoints). Therefore I would suggest to have a separate setting for static map loading while importing a gpx.

report.summary: Click on cache in map results in 'Cache not found'
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: During live-map operation (fast strategy) I had some caches (all not stored and unreliable) where I got the message 'c:geo konnte den Cache nicht finden.' (or something similar) if I clicked them. This was reproducible for the specific caches as long as the map was open. After closing the map and reopening it was back to normal.

report.summary: Exporting caches to Locus
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Hello, Is possible to implement some option for exporting caches (from Stored) to Locus? I know I can send them to Locus using Menu-Show on map-Locus. But it doesn't save them to Locus' database so it's not possible to use some features for them (such as downloading map around caches or displaying 161 m circles)... I found that if I cachange last parameter in DisplayData.sendData function (AbstractLocusApp.java, line 81) to true, Locus asks for saving caches - that's exactly what I need. So it'll be great if you'd add something like Menu-Show on map-Export to Locus. It wouldn't be that difficult, wouldn't it? Thank you! BTW I asked author of Locus about saving these temporary caches and he replied me it would be very complicated and easiest way is to ask you for implementing this straight to c:geo.

report.summary: Strange progress indicator on GPX-import
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: If I import any GPX-file I always get this kind of progess window. In this example the PQ contained 262 caches, so I don't understand the meaning of the numbers. I am quite sure, that I mentioned this somewhere already but I can not find it anymore so I open this issue.

report.summary: Context menu to refresh preview map
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: For the case of the preview map being this large red cross, it would be really nice to have a context menu to just refresh that preview map.I know I can refresh the compete cache, but sometimes my data rate may be so bad that this is much easier and faster...

report.summary: Also request more details in popup for known cache types
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: With the current market release more details when opening a cache popup are only requested if the cache type is unknown. From my point of view it would be an improvement also to request the data if the popup is opened for caches which already have a parsed cache type icon, because: It will deliver the D/T rating and cache size It will deliver the favorite points (but currently this is not used for the popup anyway) We would be able to confirm or correct the cache type (if parsing went wrong) Let's say you are using the live map to look for an appropriate cache to go for, then this information would be very useful and it will probably be faster than having to download every cache.

report.summary: Live map defaults to (same) location in Germany
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Sometimes after updating the c:geo app, the live map "resets" its location to the same place in between Göttingen and Erfurt in Germany. I live in Denmark and have never been anywhere near this location - with or without my phone. I have never done any searches in the area or imported pocket queries within that area. It has also happened upon other occations. I have not noted exactly which events cause this. If this is essential to locating the bug, I will try to be more observant of when exactly this bug occurs.

report.summary: HTTP Multipart POST implementation required
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I need a method to send multipart POST requests (to upload files) like Network.postRequest(). It's too bad that Android does not have a good http client library (and don't say that the Apache HTTP Client is a good library, also some parts are missing). I'll be very glad if somebody can help me and implement such a method in the Network-class.

report.summary: Heading line
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: One thing, I always wanted to ask for, is this "heading line" on the map between the current position and the target position (cache, waypoint). I'd find that very helpful. In fact, this is one of the very few features of the official app, I'm missing in c:geo.

report.summary: Switch cache list by horizontal scrolling
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From support mail: For easier handling of lists it would be good if the active list can be changed by scrolling horizontally (like in the cache-details).

report.summary: Refresh Log only
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: add the possibility to update cachelogs only of a stored cache, instead the whole cache. useful for premium caches, if the user isn't premium atm.

report.summary: invalid OSM Offline Map notification and disable
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Some weeks ago I installed an OSM map to save some traffic. I had the feeling that it does not work correctly, but did not check that. When I investigated today I realized that I was correct. I switched data network off on my phone and no maps were loaded.

report.summary: Refresh all caches on live map
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Hi, I don't know, if this was already here (I couldn't find it) but I would really appreciate, if you would to build in a function/button for refreshing all caches on the Live map: The Problem: I have stored a aprox. 1 year ago all caches few kilometers around the place I live. in this time, some of them didn't exist anymore, or the stored ones have and old logbook. now I need to Refresh them all, but I don't want to refresh them one-by-one. I have here aprox. 300 cashes around and it would be very time consuming. It would be great, if I have a button, and all the cashes on the Live map screen would be refreshed. I think this isn't a big deal to build in this function. What do you think ? Sorry for my english :)

report.summary: Change name of waypoint in relation to a type
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Currently when adding waypoint "name" if before "type". When you start typing a name "Sta" Autocomplete offers "stages of multi-cache", however type stays Reference point. My idea is to move "type" before "Name" and when user changes type and name is still empty the name be filled with default text. What do you think?

report.summary: Retrieve waypoint 's name from personal note
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: A nice enhancement would be to get the name of the waypoint (if there) instead automatically naming them "Personal note X". wp1: N 49° 6.707 E 009° 13.829 final= N 50° 6.808 E 009° 13.829 Format could be Name:coords or Name=coords or Name coords. In cGCache.parseWaypointsFromNote, the regex could become something like this \b([^\s]\s[:=])?([nNsS]{1})\s*\d and name could be retrieved from group 1, coords from group 2. if no group1 then default name could be used.

report.summary: Support email: GPS averaging - feedback
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Obviously Gps averaging takes many Gps points and averages them to give an accurate fix. People use it to set accurate coordinates when hiding caches. There's an ap If you are a geocacher this should be familiar. You arrive at or near a cache location and your phones Gps is not accurate by as much as 10 to 20 meters. (Especially in trees or canyon effect.) Why not offer a switch on the c:geo compass which you use when near to a cache. Switch averaging on and don't move the phone. The user will get an accurate distance and bearing to the cache. The user could move to the location and re average to home in. In a nut shell you would make c:geo the most accurate search geocache application on the market. I think you should give this consideration. Please can you give me some feed back Regards chris

report.summary: Offline-Mode: Filter "show nearby caches"
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I have downloaded caches from various cities in Germany. When I want to view all the caches on a map, I always get the entire map zoomed out. It's kind of annoying to zoom in to my particular location first. It would be nice if I can apply a filter in the map screen that includes only offline caches within a specific distance, say 3-5km. This could be implemented as a new filter, because the filtering mechanism (for example by cache type) works pretty well already with offline-stored caches.

report.summary: Support for waymarking.com GPX-imports
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Extract from support mail: Why is it I can't do the same with the .gpx that I download from waymarking.com Essentially, its the same data in the same format, but they will not load into c:geo. It asks if I want to import them then states that 0 (zero) caches were imported. If they could be identified with a little W symbol, I could load all my intended caches, waymarks and benchmarks for trip, and could then see them as they approach during my drives.

report.summary: Distance information in nearby search for BM
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: If a nearby search is performed by a basic member he will get the distance graphics only (unless he enables the re-captcha) and only basic information of the caches. People are often complaining, that e.g. "sort by distance" is not working in this case because it is still selectable but has no effect although they see the distance on the screen. First of all I thought about disabling the sorting by distance in this case (if technically possible). Same would apply for other sorting options which are not available in this case (e.g. D/T, Size, etc.). But as the distance is one of the most important information in case of a nearby(!) search it would be even better to obtain the distance information somehow. Perhaps it would be feasible to drop the support of distance-graphics and instead implement a new approach ? I once learned, that there is a very small HTML on geocaching.com used for send2gps. If I remember right, it is very small and gives coordinate information for the cache requested.

report.summary: Switch metric/imperial units for BM
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: The graphic files shown to basic members in nearby search results are in km/mi depending on the setting on geocaching.com. Some users complain that miles are shown although they selected metric units in c:geo. Reason is most likely, that imperial units are the default on geocaching.com unless the user changes this setting. For PM the setting on the website is not relevant as c:geo calculates automatically according to the setting. I suggest to implement that c:geo changes the preference on the website according to the user setting (as it is already done e.g. for the language setting) to avoid a mismatch.

report.summary: Manual download of static maps should always be possible
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Currently there is no possibility to manually download static maps for a certain cache in case the general setting "Download static maps for caches" is switched off in the settings. But switching it on in the settings will also load the static maps generally e.g. in case of GPX-imports. This has some side effects like long import time, google timing issue and restrictions. It should be possible to download static maps manually for a cache (like it is already implemented for the case that no static map is available). After this has been implemented I would further suggest to have the general setting for downloading static maps switched off in order to avoid problems on GPX-imports. My personal guess is, that only a minor percentage of users want to have a static map by default in this case. Another possibility would be to introduce a new setting for "Static map download for GPX-imports" to split up the usecases. This should be switched off by default.

report.summary: Add an option to hide "original coordinates" in map
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I agree that "original coordinates" could be useful, but most of time, map is flood with a lot of points. "Original coordinates" are then unnecessary to be displayed (in my opinion) . Adding an option to hide this kind of points could be relevant. Thanks!

report.summary: Add option to move storage to external_sd
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: The Samsung Galaxy SII, amongst other devices, mounts part of its internal storage on /sdcard and the optional SD card on /sdcard/external_sd Allow to move the .cgeo directory (or cgeo, depends on how issue #706 is implemented) to be moved to the /sdcard/external_sd directory. If the getExternalFilesDir() call does only give directories on /sdcard, maybe allow for a softlink to be created to the real storage on /sdcard/external_sd

report.summary: Fetch and cache images from GC Galleries
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I can find no way to fetch and cache images from the galleries. Having them cached is immensely useful whenever you have either no or very expensive data access. Being in abroad in holidays comes to mind :-)

report.summary: Waypoints list default action
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Is it possible to add a default action a single tap on an item of the waypoints list ? In nightly version, user should long press item in the list to open menu and then select action. Single tap does nothing ! I suggest : single tap: edit long press: menu

report.summary: Virtual list "ALL caches"
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Please make it possible to show caches from all lists on map, I think, that it's often usable. Many users (me too) have special list for solved mysteries.

report.summary: An option to Set trackables to discover
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I personally discover a lot of trackable using the search button from the cgeo main screen and have to change touch type from grabbed or retrieved to discover on each one would like to see a check box in setting to set to discover by default Sent via Hubroid

report.summary: Blue arrow over cache markers
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: This one from support email: I just have one question. When I select navigate to geocache option, map is shown with a geocache marker and my current location (arrow). When I get close to the geocache, the arrow goes underneath the geocache marker. The geocache marker is big and it is totally obscuring the arrow. Is there a way to have the arrow go over the geocache marker? This would help me (and probably others) to navigate very close to the cache location before we start searching.

report.summary: Challenges
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: What about supporting challenges like http://coord.info/CX19F4 ? the user would enable the challenge support in the settings if enabled, challenges are requested and displayed in the nearby search and in the live map a new activity ChallengeDetailActivity could be used to display challenges tapped in the live map Who's pro, who's against it ?!

report.summary: New overlays for live map
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: At the moment there are four overlays in the live map caches (online + stored + waypoints) other cachers (Go4Cache) position scale I'd like to add/splitt additional overlays resulting in overlays for online caches (limited to 500 (?) caches) stored caches (unlimited) waypoints (unlimited) challenges (see #1591) circles other cachers (Go4Cache) position scale The user could enable each overlay seperately the same way he chooses the kind of map.

report.summary: Copy gc code
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Have some simple possibility to copy the geo code if a cache, maybe from the context menu of the cache details.

report.summary: Poor notification when unable to send log
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When you made online log and you are on really bad connection c:geo is sometimes unable to send log. It's only notified as toast and it's almost the same text as found. I suggest when c:geo fails to send log a popup window should be displayed. Something like c:geo failed to post log because server is not responding. and options. Retry, save offline, go back to editing

report.summary: Allow logging directly from compass
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From support mail: It would enhance the usage if you could add a "Log visit" button directly in the compass menu.

report.summary: show today literally
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: In the log date selector, show "today" for today.

report.summary: Import and parse coordinates added to log
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When you post log you can add coordinates. c:geo currently does not do anything with it. Example: GC3JCM1, log from "trollteamet" an option to create waypoint would be great.

report.summary: Rotation of Compass Screen
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I'm looking to get a ZTE Optik in the future from Sprint and cgeo works great on it. I did notice however that wwhen the compass Screen is opened it goes to landscape view which is awkward to hold a 7 inch tablet in that orientation is it possible to add a way to rotate the compass Screen Sent via Hubroid

report.summary: Default navigation to Final waypoint instead to cache coordinates
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Hi, when cache has final waypoint with coordinates ... it'll be better to navigate and measure distances to this wpt, not to cache coords.

report.summary: Hide own/found switch on live map
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: This one is from support email: I find myself constantly switching between hiding and displaying my found caches. Any way to have a switch somewhere other than the preferences? Like the map view or caches nearby views?

report.summary: sort in reverse order
report.label: Feature Request
