report.description: I sometime need to reverse the order in a list, like when I try to find a Cache with the beginning letter "Z". But I have no option to reverse the sort-order? I read the FAQ and searched the manual... Am I blind? If not, this is a feature request ;)

report.summary: Support "Ignore Listing"
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: It would be useful if c:geo would support "Ignore Listing". Some cachers use this features to hide out caches they are not able to do (e.g. T5) from search results. Currently the search already does not show caches which are on the ignore list, it should additionally be possible to add caches to the ignore list.

report.summary: Store the found-date when importing .gpx
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Right now, the found-date of a logged cache can only be entered manually, using offline-logging. Importing the found-date from .gpx would give the posibility to sort by found-date and see a history for already found caches.

report.summary: field notes are not stored in cgeo directory
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I used field notes for the first time now and I found that we store them in a separate directory below the root, instead of using our cgeo directory. I favor having all our files in one directory, so it is easier for the app and the user to clean up.

report.summary: Allow to import caches from Bookmark-list
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: To prepare for seeking abroad, I add stuff to a bookmark list on the gc.com web site. It would be good if I could import the caches from the list into c:geo. Import could have a checkmark "full fetch" that would make c:geo not only fetch the GC codes from the bookmarks and store them as saved caches, but would also fetch the full details (and perhaps even a map snippet).

report.summary: Offline search for caches
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From support mail: After having imported a lot of PQs I have nearly 1000 caches in my different lists. Now there is a list already, but a useful addon to find a specific cache would be t have the possibility of performing a search for cache name.

report.summary: Can we support trekbuddy tarred atlas offline map format ?
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Sometimes it could be very convenient, when caches could be displayed on hiking maps (here in czech and slovakia we have realy precies maps provided by army ... today sold by shocart company). Theese maps are easy to obtain by mobile atlas creator (and there are many sources of raster maps available all over the world). Is it possible to implement using new offline map type ? I'had searched for android project that could display this type of maps ... and they are mostly closed-source freeware, but format of maps is documented.

report.summary: Also show my logs in friend-logs tab
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: The logbook page on geocaching.com has a tab for logbook, my logs and friend logs. In case I e.g. want to help someone finding a cache it would be good to have instant access to my own log for this cache. Its not worth an own tab but maybe you coud append it to the friend-log tab.

report.summary: GPX-export improvements
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From support mail. I have not enough understanding of GPX to decide whether they are justified: Thanks for GPX exporting functionality. Here are some ideas for further development in that area: possibility to configure the folder where the GPX files are exported Include following data to GPX file: Link to cache webpage Cache terrain/difficulty ratings Cache size Cache hint

report.summary: Number of people on watchlist
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From support email: Is there a chance to implement the number of people having a cache on their watchlist? This is interesting, especially for the owner.

report.summary: Show more waypoint info in compass
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Recently more cache information was added to the compass like D/T and cache size as well as the waypoint type, Maybe it would be possible to show the text for the waypoint (the note added to the waypoint) additionally. If you look e.g. at GC3FJ5F the wapoints note includes the question to answer. While caching you navigate to that waypoint and the compass shows "Question to answer" but to see the question I have to go back to the waypoint view to see it. It could be implemented in the line used for the type of waypoint (e.g. "Question to answer:......) or even below the compass as an additional text line above the current coordinates. From my point of view it will be very helpful to know what to do, without the need to go back from compass to other views.

report.summary: add start time to calendar entry
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: No description provided.

report.summary: Cache status update
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Is there a chance of updating only the status of a list of caches or making a sub-menu( or options menu) for updating caches in a list (already in archive) ? A funtion that only update the status (active, disabled, archived) for a list or selected caches? For example, having options for update caches, like: FULL (all cache update) This is what we have now [in my android it takes +-1min/cache] MEDIUM (Cache Status, Logs and possible GCvote/Favorite rattings ) LOW (Cache Status)

report.summary: Cyclestreets.net maps
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: One from support. I don't know this app and if it's possible It would be helpful if I could use the maps produced by Cyclestreets.net to tie in with c:geo. This is especially as they have made an offline UK Map Pack available as an Android app. Unfortunately, when I am using c:geo, the map pack doesn't appear under the list of available options. Can you advise how I can integrate the two?

report.summary: Remove or Replace Go4Cache support
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: It seems the api from go4cache is down since a few days and also the website www.go4cache.com is no longer available. Some of the users (including me) really miss this feature. AFAIK the service was offered by a 3rd party (who?). If this is not only a temporary outage we should think about, what to do with the go4cache implementation: Is it possible and allowed to take it over to c:geo servers or else remove it from c:geo.

report.summary: Also have a history of caches viewed
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From support mail: Currently the history only lists caches which where a log has been composed (online or offline). It would be a useful feature to also have a history of the most recent cache which have been viewed in c:geo. This could be done in a common list with the current history or (better) as a separate history list. Usecase: I look into some caches which I want to go for soon. Afterwards I want to navigate to those caches but have to look them up again manually and might have forgotten the name which makes it difficult. The user is not refering to the geocaching.com feature but a standalone c:geo feature.

report.summary: Include coordinate conversion to UTM in cache details
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Currently the cache coords can be converted to DMS, DegDec and MinDec by tapping on the coords. Some users requested that a conversion to UTM could also be included here, which would make a transfer of coords to devices using UTM easier.

report.summary: Use 'better' ordering for refreshing of stored caches
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Hello, The reason for this issue comes mainly from issue #1602. If you import/store/refresh a large number of caches, you'll hit the google maps api limit for static maps. Issue #1602 covers a fundamental change to handle this situation better. I am thinking of a quick improvement which could help a lot. If we sort the caches before starting the actual refresh/loaddetails thread, we can make sure that after a while all caches are refreshed (and have static maps). My first thought was to order them by the 'property' "hasStaticMaps". So caches that don't have static maps, will be first in the list and get refreshed first. After that I thought maybe a more general solution would be to just order the caches by "lastUpdated" timestamp. So the ones that have the oldest stored data, get refreshed first. This would cover my use-case, but also kinda makes sense in a general way. Let me know what you think, I think making a patch would not be too difficult. Once I have the dev environment up and running that is.

report.summary: Use OSM map files from navfree ?
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Hello, I was wondering whether we could use the OSM map files used by navfree. Usecase: I have Navfree app installed on my phone. It offers trun by turn navigation using offline maps. It uses OSM maps. So I have the benelux and france maps downloaded on my device (for my holiday). This is about 1.5G of map data. I also have c:geo installed, for I want to use also offline maps. For this I need OSM map files also, whichs means another 1.5G. Question: Could we re-use the OSM map files from navfree? It seems they use a different format, but possible this format is also supported by the mapsforge? The files/folders used in this format look like this (Benelux map): +---map_osm_6.1.0.152 +---blx +---bel ¦ +---poi_osm_6.1.0.152 ¦ ¦ belgium@bel.4.poi.4.ydb ¦ ¦ ¦ +---map_osm_6.1.0.152 ¦ belgium.alb ¦ belgium@bel.4.ydb ¦ Settings.txt ¦ +---lux ¦ +---poi_osm_6.1.0.152 ¦ ¦ luxembourg@lux.33.poi.35.ydb ¦ ¦ ¦ +---map_osm_6.1.0.152 ¦ luxembourg.alb ¦ luxembourg@lux.33.ydb ¦ Settings.txt ¦ +---nld +---poi_osm_6.1.0.152 ¦ nitherlands@nld.35.poi.37.ydb ¦ +---map_osm_6.1.0.152 netherlands.alb nitherlands@nld.35.ydb Settings.txt I found a page about OSM formats, but I'm not sure this is the place to look. While writing this issue, I stumbled upon the mapsforge ginary format page, which gives me the feeling mapsforge has developed its own format?

report.summary: Additional signature for {*FTF*} logs
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: It should be possible to define a second signature for ftf logs, amongst other things. You should be able to use templates for the second signature too.

report.summary: Translation context menu for travel bug logs
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I just had a French log entry on a travel bug. In contrast to cache logs there is no possibility to translate the entry. Also sharing is not possible, which might be a nice workaround.

report.summary: Quicker change of OSM offline maps
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: One from support email: I live in Holland near the Belgium and German border. So I often go looking for geocaches her. But outside my own country I don't have an internet connection on my Android phone. So I use offline maps (open street maps). Every time I want select an other map (country) I have to go in c:geo back to the main menu and to preferences and scroll all the way down. Is it possible to make it quicker to change offline maps? Or is it even possible to show all the downloaded maps at once? So I don't have to choose a map anymore.

report.summary: Don't use cookies in send2cgeo
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From support mail: For the send2cgeo – Userscript it is necessary to accept cookies. If the cookies are deleted (so in my case) I have to reconnect/reregistrate my browser and phone on your homepage before I use the script on the GC-homepage. The Greasemonkey-Project allows you to store some data in the browser (also after restart), so that you don’t need cookies!

report.summary: Filter "Only non PM caches"
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From support mail: Currently in lists and nearby result you can filter "Status" -> "Only PM". Would it be possible to implement the inverse function "Only Non-PM", which could be quite useful for basic member to hide those from the result. I agree to that, on the other hand I know that the whole filter thing should be reworked. However I think this would be easy to do at the mentioned place as a workaround for now.

report.summary: Display Option 'Hide own and found caches' more prominent
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: An option I change quite often is 'Hide own and found caches' in 'further options'. Sometimes I want to show this cache to other cachers, or look for new logs and can't find the cache, because the option is set wrong. Next time I'm looking for unfound caches by e.g. adress and the option is set wrong again and shows me found caches, too. Would it be possible to display and change this option on main-screen (like the cache-type icon) or in the search-dialog? Or somewhere else to change it quicker?

report.summary: Option to delete and/or edit own logs
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Sometimes when typing, the sneaky keyboard hides and you press "send log" accidentially.

report.summary: Template for cache owner
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Currently log templates only include items about the time and user. Since logging is done in the context of a particular cache, can some items be referenced about the cache too? I am particularly interested in the cache-owner (getOwnerDisplayName()), who many name in their log entries. Unfortunately, I'm only just skilled enough in Java to be dangerous....

report.summary: When offline CGEO tries to login everytime homescreen is visited
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Hi, I'm not sure if this is desired behaviour, but it feels strange to me that everytime I visit the homescreeen of cgeo, the app tries to Login. This is maybe a good feature when a network connection is present, however when out caching my network status doesn't change. Maybe it is just me, but I feel that this is a not needed power consumption. I'd prefer an 'Offline Mode' where no login-checks are performed.

report.summary: Option to show waypoint from a cache
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: To specify for showing waypoints depending on the number of caches in configuration settings is not really practical. Better way to get a option at the cache for showing his waypoints.

report.summary: Ability to delete GPX import files
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: No description provided.

report.summary: History for trackable codes
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: The search page should have a history for the last 10 trackable codes entered. This might be the only way to find a trackable again some time later if you don't immediately log it.

report.summary: Support personal note sync
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: After implementation of #409 with PR #1741 it is now possible to create/edit the personal note. However synchronization is not yet supported but this should be implemented on short term if possible as the current behavior is not user-friendly. Currently: Notes from gc.com are shown and can be edited A new note can be created On updating the cache details a personal note created in the app is deleted (if empty on website) or overwritten by the personal note from gc.com Desired behaviour (to be discussed): If the personal note on gc.com is empty and local note is existing this note should be uploaded to gc.com. This could be done instantly when creating or (IMHO better) if the cache is updated If personal notes are existing locally and remote there needs to be an alignment in some way (e.g. take the longer one, ask the user, etc.)

report.summary: Set current position (in absence of GPS)
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: It is perhaps related to #1039 but has a different angle IMHO (and I could not find a similar request). Just recently there was a question on geoclub if it is possible to set your 'current' or 'home' coordinates in c:geo. While the latter is discussed in #1039 I think the former would be a useful feature especially when without GPS (either no signal indoors or switched off). I f we allow to enter (or better select on the map) the current location, everything (like cache distances, nearby search, etc.) could be displayed in relation to that. Edit: corrected referenced issue (typo)

report.summary: Add a bug-reporting function to c:geo
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: As per the discussion on #2128, we could add a new bug-reporting function to c:geo that would let a user send a mail to the reporting address with an attachment made of the last log entries. To avoid needing any permission on any Android version, we could exploit the fact that all our logs go through cgeo.geocaching.utils.Log static methods and add a circular buffer storing the N last logs (such as the 500 last entries).

report.summary: Navigation for walking
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: There should be an additional entry to start navigation in walking mode.

report.summary: change background color for offline maps
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When viewing caches near to the sea with offline maps, you don't see where land ends and sea begins. More general: you don't see where your map ends. I suggest to change the background color of maps to light blue or grey. compare these screenshots of the same destination: google maps: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/49879320/cgeoissue%20map%20bgcolor/20121122_194901.jpg offline map: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/49879320/cgeoissue%20map%20bgcolor/20121122_194920.jpg

report.summary: Edit personal note for unsaved caches
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: As a consequence of #2197 the editing button for the personal note was hidden as long as the cache is not stored for offline use. Once #2122 is implemented (sync note to gc.com) it should also be possible to edit/sync notes for unsaved caches.

report.summary: Support Proxy
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: HTC One X / Android 4.0.x Reading my gmail, I see a published cache notification. I click the link in the email - http://coord.info/GC4xxxx. What do you want to complete this action with - cgeo, chrome, etc - I choose cgeo cgeo spins for a while on 'Loading cache details' Error 'cgeo failed to download the cache. Unknown communication error' Same result if I try to load the cache using the GC code in the 'Search' tool. Live map with 'live' enabled also doesn't display the cache. Hmmm. I'm going to struggle to FTF this one if cgeo won't load it. I add a waypoint manually and hop in the car. I got it ten minutes after publication. Job done ;-) Now I'm trying again back at the office later on to see why I couldn't download it. This is on wi-fi with manual proxy settings. My proxy server logs show no connection attempts being made by my android. It's like cgeo isn't going through the proxy properly. Normal browser pages load fine in chrome or in other browsers on my android. My gmail loads fine over the wifi. But cgeo? Nope. I'm about 85% sure this used to work on the office wifi with the proxy, but I could be wrong. Either way, it ought to work fine through a proxy. I have full access to the company proxy server, so I know what is/isn't being blocked at the proxy level; I can see no evidence of cgeo even connecting to the proxy. Is cgeo using the wifi proxy settings properly?

report.summary: Hosting of map icons
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Maps icons are currently hosted on carnero.cc. We should move them, for example on status.cgeo.org, or any site we control.

report.summary: Upload of new coordinates progress bar
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: The upload of new coordinates can sometimes be quite long, and should be signalled by a progress indicator. Related to #2271.

report.summary: Improve color markers in TB logbook
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Currently the log type "Discovered", "Visited", "Grabbed" and "Retrieved" have a green marker. The log type "Placed" and "Write note" have a grey marker. I suggest to keep the green marker for "Discovered" and "Visited" and use another green tone (maybe brighter green) for the types "Placed", "Retrieved" and "Grabbed" as these logs indicate a "real progress". Only "Write note" should stay with the grey marker.

report.summary: Have a link to "related webpage" in cache details
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From support mail: GC.com allows naming a related webpage. Sometimes this is used to refer to important cache information or even necessary for solving a mystery. Example: GC3BCT0 Unfortunately the link to the related webpage is not visible in c:geo. It could be added in the hint section like the spoiler-image link.

report.summary: Direct launcher for Map/Stored caches list
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Hi all, I have an idea, as it is now obsolete to have dashboard (according to current google's recomendations) and as I use app, I discovered, that I often only skip dashboard to list of caches or active map (I don't use other options very often). I have done small test ... I added intent filter for launcher to several activities ... and it seems to be usable at least for offline list (minor change needed .. default value of type value is null ... changed to OFFLINE)and google maps activity, other map activities crash when started directly, but this could be fixed. What is your opinion on this ? If we are not dependent on going though dashboard ... we can speedup app a lot and make it much more usable. For lists it will be possible to create direct shortcuts to particular lists (the same as you can obviously create shortcuts to particular folder on SD card).

report.summary: have "attended" as initial selection, when already logged "will attend"
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: For event caches, if there is already a "will attend" log by the current user, then the initial selection in the log type field should be "attended" (to save one click of the user).

report.summary: Launcher icon for xhdpi is missing
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: A 96x96 launcher icon for xhdpi resolution should be put in folder res/drawable-xhdpi. It should be added to the release branch.

report.summary: send2cgeo for opencaching.de
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: As we now can download oc.de caches directly, an adaption of send2cgeo for opencaching.de would be a good idea (as was mentioned in #1334)

report.summary: Mark waypoints as done/visited
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: There are many multis, whrere you need to collect indicies from many wpts spread whole city ... and it is obvious, that it is not possible, that you can not get all info in one day. So I have an idea, that wpts could be marked by user that you have visited that place and gathered info. This mark should hide wpt from map and differentiate it in wpts list. Does it make sense for you?

report.summary: Generate GPX 1.1 file
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Is there any reason we generate GPX 1.0 file? The 1.0 format was standardized in 2002, and was superseded in 2004 by GPX 1.1. See http://www.topografix.com/gpx.asp I propose to switch to GPX 1.1. Any remark?

report.summary: Remove spaces when editing coordinates
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: My language setting is German. When I add a waypoint (eg. station of a multicache) and enter coordinates in "simple" mode, then the current coords are shown using ',' as the comma, but when I enter a coordinate using ',' the fractional part is set to '000'. Example: When adding a waypoint, the coordinate entry (simple mode) shows: N 48° 12,345 Now I change it to N 48° 11,345 (note, that it only occurs when the ',' is re-entered) When I save, it shows N 48° 11,000

report.summary: Remove numbers in braces for management menu items
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: In the caches list, when selection mode is active and only a subset of the caches is selected, then every item has the number of selected caches as suffix. This should be in the title only to reduce the clutter.

report.summary: Use waypoint prefix (or lookup code) instead of id
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Right now, we use an "id" to identify the waypoint, which is the row id in the database. Not only this will not survive a backup/restore which does not copy the database, but also it duplicates information: the prefix and lookup code are both unique for a given geocode. We should use a couple (geocode, prefix) (or (geocode, lookup)) to identify a waypoint uniquely.

report.summary: Image page: load on click
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Currently a popup opens when you scroll to the image page in cache details. But what if you want to scroll to the trackable page? Then you must wait or press "back" first. I'd suggest to either hide the popup or load images only on request (maybe the user wants to use c:geo offline).

report.summary: Load OC caches in preferred language (OKAPI)
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I had a discussion with some OKAPI people, and we miss to load cache descriptions of multi-lingual caches in the users language. Example German/Dutch: http://www.opencaching.nl/viewcache.php?cacheid=5177 Example Dutch/English: http://www.opencaching.nl/viewcache.php?cacheid=5199

report.summary: Edit coordinates: treatment of fractional seconds
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Today I was doing a multi-cache where I got coordinates in DDMMSS-style, e.g. with 23.4''. When entering them in our dialog, the fractional part as '4' it was interpreted as '004', which surprised me (and took a while to notice). Even if I think this interpretation would be well aligned with my expectations regarding fractional minutes (the three digits are so 'standard' to me that I simply do not see them as fraction). I'd rather not prepend trailing zeros for fractional seconds. What do you think?

report.summary: provide maps to users
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Hi, what if we ourselves provide downloads for maps for the users? As I understand, we have a server on our hands and I bet it is idling around most of the time. And mapsforge doesn't provide downloads for some countries yet. For example Thailand is not on their list. a) generate (missing) maps with osmosis on a regular basis and link to available downloads on mapsforge b) add links in settings to open cgeo-download pages (and mapsforge) c) in a later stage we could even integrate the download into c:geo Wouldn't it be cool if cgeo.org is the most complete download server for mapsforge maps in the world?

report.summary: Scale log image for upload
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: We scale images on download to fit the display. Can we also scale images for upload to reduce mobile data?

report.summary: Picture upload progress indicator or warning on huge size
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Following on the discussion #2533 and dependent on the decision about that. Some users will not understand why uploading with photo takes ages for them. So what about a progress indicator if technically possible (in %). Or we could have a warning toast message if the image exceeds a certain size, which states "You attached a highres image. Uploading might take a long time depending on your mobile connection".

report.summary: Create individual types of waypoints when importing personal note from gc.com
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: If I got it right the import functionality of personal notes from GC.com creates waypoints of type "reference point" for each detected coordinate string. Would be a nice feature when the import could identify coordinates tagged with keywords to create other types of waypoints during import from GC.com E.g. personal note: "Parking area at PARKING=N 50° 40.666E 006° 58.222 My calculated final coordinates: FINAL=N 50° 40.777E 006° 58.111 Get some ice cream at N 50° 40.555E 006° 58.000" Import creates one waypoint of type "parking area", one of type "final" and one of the default type "reference point"

report.summary: Sorting caches by "Wilson score confidence interval"
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Feature Request: Right now it is possible to sort caches by the absolute number of fav-points received. To get an even better ranking of the best geocaches, sorting by a "Wilson score confidence interval" would be very useful. On http://project-gc.com (menu Cache stats) you can see a comparison of various methods.

report.summary: No directory chooser for offline maps
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Description There is no directory choser in the offline map directory settings. Steps to reproduce Store a map in /sdcard/Locus/mapsVector Open c:geo Settings --> Offline Maps Press ... Result Only the maps stored in /sdcard/Locus/mapsVector are shown as a list Expected A directory chooser where you can select the directory with map files. Not sure if bug or feature request, so I selected both.

report.summary: Support one click coordinate conversion also on waypoint tab
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Idea of a user: Currently on the cache-detail screen the coordinate format can be changed by tapping onto the coordinates. On the waypoint tab however this is not working, but you have to edit the waypoint, use the dropdown selection to change the format and read it from the editor window. It would be a useful addon and an alignment of the user interface if this one click conversion would also work on the waypoint tab. Usecase: For car navigation the car does only accept DMS and you have to first edit the parking waypoint before you can use the coordinates in you car navigation each time.

report.summary: Language changes
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When I open c:geo, my standard geocaching.com language (german) is set to english, so the app can work. This should be reset when c:geo is closed/logged of. I have to manually reset it now.

report.summary: Custom waypoints lost after version update
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From support mail: Each time after an update I am loosing the custom waypoints I saved for a stored cache in c:geo. I did not test it. Can someone check what happens with custom waypoints (those created in c:geo) during a database upgrade.

report.summary: Filter out stored caches
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From support mail: I would appreciate having a possibility to filter out stored caches e.g. in search results. Usually I have several caches stored and use the search function to find new caches which are not already stored on my device.

report.summary: select "attended" by default, if event cache is expired
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: No description provided.

report.summary: Speech output in compass
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: As I believe that the integration and rework of GCBabble is a huge effort, I've now implemented our own speaking service. Can be started and stopped from the menu of the compass (and runs as long as the compass activity only). Currently it updates the voice output every 30 seconds and tells you "11 o'clock, 270 meters". The voice output probably makes absolutely no sense in other languages than German and English, as it will use your locale for the voice, but the English text (as there are no other translations yet). Have fun.

report.summary: Enable personal note editing for unstored caches
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: As users have trouble finding out why there is no "edit" button. When using this on unstored caches, simply ask for storing first.

report.summary: Variable speech output interval
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Improvement proposal for the speech output function recently integrated by @Bananeweizen : Currently a fixed interval of 30s is implemented. The GCBabble offered a settings for this (which I do not suggest to implement) and also an adaptive speaking (which does not work for me or I do not know how it is supposed to work). After thinking a bit about it my idea would be: Implement an adaptive speaking interval which triggers an output each time the distance to target has decreased or increased by a certain value and only keep the minimum interval at 30 (or 20 ?) seconds in case of no movement (distance does not change or change of distance is below the aforementioned limit). I would propose the following distance steps for that (to be discussed) assuming a walking navigation: 1000m distance: 200m 500-1000m distance: 100m 200-500m distance: 50m 100m-200m distance: 20m 0-100m distance: 10m As the speed output itself takes some time there has to be a lower limit of 5s anyway to avoid triggering the next output while the first is still running.

report.summary: Feature-Request: Circles on the map only around physical stages
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: May I wish for a new feature? Right now if I chose to display circles on the map, a circle is displayed around each and every feature (finals, waypoints, original coordinates). In a densely populated area the map can get rather crowded and it is hard to see which circle belongs to which object, making it difficult to find a free spot to place a new cache. It would be really cool, if the 161m-circles around caches would only be displayed around physical objects like finals (of traditionals and user-entered final coordinates of multis and mysteries) and stages of multicaches, because only with those physical stages the 161m-rule is important. You might add a new option to display circles around everything or only around physical stages.

report.summary: Filter cache list by distance
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Especially handy for exporting and sharing GPX files with caching buddies would be the ability to filter the cache list by distance. That way, I'm sending only a few dozen nearby caches in the GPX instead of my entire list of 500+.

report.summary: Pocket Query Creator
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I have just found this app: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.pquery It has a GPLv3 license with the source code at: http://code.google.com/p/pocket-query-creator/ It can download existing PQ-files from gc.com and also create new PQs and download them. Would it be an option to think about implementing such a feature ? For PM it is a very convenient method of managing PQs in combination with later import to c:geo.

report.summary: Feature Request: loglink to email
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Hi, i am using the "send via email" feature to "mark" found caches. I don't like to write my foundlogs on the road, so i send found caches via email to myself and post my logs at home on my pc. so it would be nice to have the link to the post-page in the email. there is not mucht to do there, just put the link as following into the email: http://www.geocaching.com/seek/log.aspx?WP={$GCCODE} maybe this could be optional? thanks

report.summary: hide empty sections in trackable view
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: TB2T01N has no description, but we show an empty section.

report.summary: Browse PQs as nearby search
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: This is one of the features requested on Mega in Wels is read PQs as nearby search #1779 is similar but not as much.. When you open a list of PQs: http://www.geocaching.com/pocket/default.aspx you get a list of all PQs Every PQ has a link to "Preview" the PQ (as nearby search http://www.geocaching.com/seek/nearest.aspx?pq=xyz ) Users would like to see that list as nearby search.

report.summary: opencaching.pl - offline logs
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: c:geo is able to load GPX files from opencaching.pl. However, there is no option to log found caches offline. I understand that online logging may be difficult to implement, but offline should be easy and is enough to be able to log caches manually online at home. Opencaching.pl asks as well for time in addition to date.

report.summary: Support import from Dropbox
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: This question was raised now several times on support mail, therefore I would like to bring it here to get your feedback: There are users who store their GPX file collection or pocket queries on Dropbox and are asking if it is possible to offer a direct import over the Dropbx app. I have actually no idea if this is technically possible at all.

report.summary: Allow deletion of personal note waypoints
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Currently those auto generated waypoints cannot be deleted.

report.summary: Use search term as default title when creating list from search
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: No description provided.

report.summary: Support keyword for virtual cache logging
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: There seem to be some caches (virtual) which require a passkey/keyword in order to place found logs. Example: OCB68A In c:geo I can compose a found log (I did not send it because I did not really visit it), on the website I need the passkey to post a found log. I don't know whether the API supports this and I don't know whether I can post a found log via c:geo even without entering the password.

report.summary: Ask for list on attachment import
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: We already ask to confirm the import. That dialog should not only be a confirmation, but also a target list selection.

report.summary: Support .obf offline maps
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From support mail (don't know whether it is feasible): Hello ! Is it possible that you implement the support of .obf files (Osmand) for offline maps? Up to now you only can use .map files from mapsforge.

report.summary: Support Google Bike Navigation
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From support mail: Hello c:geo-team, is it possible that you can integrate Google Maps Bike Navigation in the app like navigation (driving) or navigation (go).

report.summary: Support download of personal note for opencachning
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: The personal note on opencaching can be retrieved through OKAPI. (unfortunately is an upload not possible)

report.summary: Have trail on live map more permanent
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From FB: When one exits the map and enter the cachedescription for logging and then enters the map afterwards the trace is gone. Request: Track on map log. Would like a track log that shows the track even if one have closed the map and opened it once again. Just like a track log on a real GPS. Reasson: Have been some places where mapcoverage isn't good and would like the possibilities to "backtrace" ones footsteps. Also when leaving the live map by using the back key the trail is lost. It would be could to keep it running/saved as long as c:geo is active with a menu option on the map menu to clear it.

report.summary: check calendar before adding event
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I just got 5 reminders for an event cache due to 5 entries for it in my calendar. Probably from some debugging. To avoid this, c:geo should check for existence of a calendar entry with the same name and time.

report.summary: WP static maps not created on explicit request
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: If I choose menu / navigate / store static maps they are not stored due to settings. Although settings are off for static maps for wp or cache I would expect it they can be downloaded on explicit request. Otherwise we should remove the menu choice. Will have to look at this.

report.summary: Support GeoKrety
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Hi, I am just curious... Is possible to show GeoKrety trackables in Geocaching caches? I think it is not implemented yet because I didnt see Geokret which was in my last cache in cgeo in trackables... but it was shown on GC.com websites with GeoKrety plugin...¨ Thank you

report.summary: personal note: Show progress storing cache
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When choosing "edit" personal note for caches not stored we get a choice to store cache first or cancel. When choosing OK the button stays inverted until the cache is stored. We should get a progress dialog here.

report.summary: Support for offline maps from Android app Mapy.cz
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Mapy.cz map application by Seznam.cz now supports offline maps. It would be great if c:geo supported this android app's map data.

report.summary: Field note upload "since last export" should be controlled by c:geo
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Currently the option "since last export" in the field note upload dialog will only activate the appropriate checkbox on geocaching.com fieldnote page. This has some disadvantages: The checkbox is only existing on the webpage if there are still pending logs (it can be used to add more notes to an already exisiting list of pending notes only). If a user exports field notes from c:geo, logs all the notes on gc.com and later exports again as he has new offline logs, all stored offline logs will be again shown on gc.com (old ones and new ones). We could delete the offline logs in c:geo once the export and upload is OK, but as exporting them does not mean logging them, this might raise other problems. So saving an own timestamp of the last export (not use the gc.com feature) and exporting only logs newer than that sound like a better way.

report.summary: Settings to enable/disable all navigation apps
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: By now we explicitly support around 12 different navigation apps and tools (e.g. bike navigation, Oruxmaps and that stuff). While that is really nice for the people who want to invoke exactly their app, I find this menu is starting to get huge (at least on my device). As we now have better settings, it would probably make sense to add another category to the navigation screen, where each navigation app can be disabled using a checkbox. Each would be checked by default, and only for installed apps the preference would be enabled.

report.summary: Live map should start at last position if not fixed to current position
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: A feature request from support mail which I fully agree to: Open the live map Move it manually to the desired location (which means "fix to current position" is off) Leave the live map Enter the live map again Result: It starts at the current position ("fixed to current position" is on again) Desired behaviour: In case the map was moved to another position before it was closed it should open again on this very position (right now we only store the last zoom but it seems not the last position)

report.summary: send2cgeo Firefox add-on
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Hi, is there a reason why there is no Firefox AddOn? The idea I have is to remove the need for Greasemonkey, as I find this to be cumbersome for novice users. It would be fairly simple to do this, 5 lines with the AddOn builder and page-mod. Though, one possible issue I see with this is the update mechanism, as for each change of the script the addon would need to be updated as well, but then Firefox would update the app automatically. Furthermore I have one off-topic question, is the server side code for send2cgeo publicly available as well? Looking forward for feedback.

report.summary: have search term as new list name
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When searching for caches online, it would be nice to have the search term as the default name of a new list created from the search results.

report.summary: Set cursor in personal notes at the end
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: For personal notes, waypoint notes and potentially other input fields we should set the cursor to the end of the input field because appending to them has a higher probability than adding text at the very start of the note.

report.summary: Default for waypoints in cache map should be higher than zero
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Nobody finds that option

report.summary: Have settings active by default
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Ask for list

report.summary: Show "will attend" state
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: It is not possible to see whether one has logged "will attend" for an event except by looking at the (potentially incomplete) logs.

report.summary: Support navigation with OSMand
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From support mail: Using navigation with OSMand would be really good, as it provides offline navigation. Right now I can only use "Show on external map" but this will only open OSMand at that position but not navigate to it.

report.summary: Use different coloured smilies for found/dnf/etc
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Feature request: It's sometimes a bit irritating if all caches with offline-logs gets the same red smiley on the map, whether I loged a found or a dnf. Whould be nice to see a difference, for example different colours for the smiley.

report.summary: Auto-select offline map
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I've recently switched c:geo to use offline maps, in preparation for a trip to Italy. In the UK, the offline maps are separate for England, Wales, Scotland etc. When I move from one region to another, I have to manually go into the settings and select the right map, it would be nice if this was picked according to location. For bonus point: revert back to "live" map when no offline one is present (especially when browsing the map) - for instance, I'm set to England right now as I'm at home, but I was scrolling around the live map looking for caches in Italy... but no map appears, making it hard.

report.summary: Create the possibillity to keep user generated data when replacing a PQ
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Feature request: I am using c:geo with different Pocket Querys. From time to time it is necessary to replace the hole PQ. There is no other easy way to keep all data up to date. (updating the caches whould not bring new caches in the area and not delete archived caches. And additionaly needs needs much time, data-plan-usage and gc-server-capacity). Like much users I have a list for each PQ. So I have to delete all caches in the list and import a newer PQ for that area. But all self-created waypoints etc. get lost in that moment. I whould like a possibillity to keep all that kind of data. I know it whould waste much phone-storage-place to keep every waypoint of deleted caches from holidays years before. Thats not the best way. But perhaps its possible to delete the data some time later after thethe cachelisting and only if there is not the same cache stored on the phone again in the meantime?? Or a complete different posibillity to replace a PQ?

report.summary: Support other calendars than the default one
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From FB: I have a wish for the calender add-on. It automatically uses the standard calender app from my device, but I installed Jorte calender. It ist not possible to change the calender app in this add-on. Could you add this function some day?

report.summary: Field notes export window does not remember my preference
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I have latest NB from 2013.08.25 When uploading field notes, there are two questions: upload to GC only since last export I wish the c:geo remember my previous setting.

report.summary: Support opencaching.us via OKAPI
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Users request on suport mail: He told that opencaching.us should support it already and asked if we could include it. As the US are one of the big "markets" where c:geo is used this sounds reasonable.

report.summary: Feature request: Show mapsforge-map "bigger" on high-res-displays
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: The Text of Street-, Building-, and Area-Names is displayed very small on high-res-devices. In the moment I help myself with zoom in and try to read the text in that second until the more detailed map picture is shown (with small text again). In that second the text have a nice-to-read-sice. I have no very bad eyes so I think we need a "bigger" map-scale for high-res-displays.

report.summary: Collection of ideas to analyse and improve live-map performance
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: IRC-discussion with Lineflyer: (22:30:41) Lineflyer: another last question (22:30:53) Lineflyer: live map seems to have lost performance in the last months. (22:31:12) rsudev: You mean gc.com live map? (22:31:13) Lineflyer: I am not sure if this is just gc.com (after their tile server change) (22:31:16) Lineflyer: c:geo (22:31:29) rsudev: gc.com in c:geo? (22:31:33) Lineflyer: yes (22:31:58) Lineflyer: Now something really weired out of my mind (22:32:29) Lineflyer: In the logs is see "Cache XY loaded from DB" or "Cache xy returned no results" for each and every cache parsed from live map (22:32:59) Lineflyer: I am really not sure if this was the procedure ever since or came in new (22:33:09) Lineflyer: COuld this slow done the whole process? (22:33:31) Lineflyer: I see some 0,2-0,5 seconds or sometimes even more between those consecutive requests (22:33:55) Lineflyer: Are these DB requests? (22:34:04) Lineflyer: DB is slow,...isnt it? (22:34:04) rsudev: These are DB requests (22:34:10) rsudev: they are slow (22:34:29) rsudev: We need them to get coords and found state of stored caches (and type and...) (22:34:40) Lineflyer: Was it always like that? Or maybe due to changes in merging data? (22:34:50) rsudev: they could be fater if bundled (22:35:02) Lineflyer: fater :D (22:35:05) Lineflyer: ;) (22:35:07) rsudev: That I am not sure of - I copuld try to research this (22:35:16) rsudev: fater faster :) (22:35:55) Lineflyer: cachecache = DB Right? (22:36:00) rsudev: no (22:36:15) rsudev: cachecache helps avoiding db (22:36:46) Lineflyer: isnt cachecache just for unsaved caches (22:37:40) Lineflyer: saved with listid=0 (22:37:47) Lineflyer: in DB (22:37:48) Lineflyer: ? (22:38:14) rsudev: No. Its for all. Its the only place where we hold livemap caches, but all detailed ones are in the db and in the cachecache if needed (22:38:25) Lineflyer: mmh (22:39:24) Lineflyer: couldnt we load all saved caches to cachecache when starting cgeo or livemap ? (Again: Just brainstorming wiithout any deep knowledge) (22:40:03) Lineflyer: Sadly the c:geo version of just after introduction of cachecache is no longer working (22:40:20) Lineflyer: I remember an impressive performance boost at that time (22:40:34) rsudev: We can't generally, as even the big phones do not have enough memory for that (22:40:40) Lineflyer: ok (22:41:45) Lineflyer: I would really love to have a flow chart of how that live map merging works to analyze and improve...but this will not be easy (22:41:46) rsudev: We can try to bulk load caches in the live-map area (we do that anyway, hmmm) (22:42:13) rsudev: Perhaps these additional requests are just not needed (22:42:58) Lineflyer: As said...It is just my brain telling me that those hundreds of "Cache xy retuned no results" was not present in the past (months ago) (22:44:13) rsudev: those should be relatively fast, I assume (22:44:51) Lineflyer: not really...afair... some weeks ago I posted this somewhere that I see a maximum of 2-3 lines per second in the log

report.summary: Introduce Range limit for opencaching 'nearby' searches
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Always returning the twenty first results from opencaching seems to be not a good idea, as you may be far off the mainland of a particular site and thus receive a number of meaningless results (several thousand kilometers away). One option can be to manually switch this site off (which would lead to some missed caches as the occasional cache is placed her and there even far off the mainland. I suggest to introduce a maximum range instead of about 100 or 200 km.

report.summary: Feature request: Talking list
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: This was already mentioned in #417. A lot of request are on support email and facebook to implement talking list in addition to talking compass. Talking list would give you spoken instructions to the next cache. Like for power trails for example. The question just remains what is the next cache. Caches that are "in front of you" (9 o'clock - 3 o'clock) Caches that are not found (and do not have stored log) Only caches that have a strage there (would it make sense to talk for misteries?) Shall it work only on stored lists or also on nearby, etc... I have also selected feedback to get feedback.

report.summary: Make hint box clickable
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I've got several reports of the hint decoding not being triggered. Probably because the area is to small.

report.summary: Log list view below log form
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: To make it easier to count event attendee numbers we soul simply have the log view below the log form.

report.summary: Event cache pop-up should show the date of the event
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: No description provided.

report.summary: Default event log type should depend on date
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Starting from event date the default should be "attended", before that it should be "will attend"

report.summary: Put history in list selection
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When selecting a list, we have pseudo entries for "all" and "new list". I think it might be good to also have "history" there to more easily switch to that list.

report.summary: Switch from history to other list by title click
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When being in the history list, the title click does not lead to a list selection pop-up. It does nothing. This is surprising for users, therefore this should just work in all lists without any special exception.

report.summary: Propose to remove list when all caches are removed
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When more than one cache is removed since we opened a non-default list view, we should propose to remove the list as well. We do it the other way around (propose to remove the caches when we remove the list) but some users might just remove all the caches, expecting to be able to remove the list at the same time.

report.summary: Images from opencaching.pl don't download
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I found issue with opencaching.pl cache images. C:GEO only download spoiler image, but not download other cache images. You can try this bug in cache OP4FE1 (http://opencaching.pl/viewcache.php?cacheid=20454). Other - on opencaching.pl there are some other attributes than in gc.com, so maybe you can add this attributes (http://wiki.opencaching.pl/index.php/Parametry_skrzynki).

report.summary: Use long press on filter button to reset filter
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Currently short press and long press on the main menu item "Filter" has the same result. It will open the cache type filter list. I suggest to use the long press for resetting it to "All caches"

report.summary: Detect and report time-skew that prevents okapi access
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: If the time-stamp betwenn device and the OKAPI-site is higher than a certain limit, all requests are denied. We can (and should) detect this situation and report it back to allow the user to adjust the device time and timezone. A sample answer (with http response code 400): {"error":{"developer_message":"Expired timestamp, yours 1378850423, ours 1378878830 (threshold 300).", "reason_stack":["invalid_oauth_request","invalid_timestamp"], "status":400,"yours":"1378850423", "ours":1378878830, "difference":28407, "threshold":300, "more_info":"http:\/\/opencaching.pl\/okapi\/introduction.html#errors"}}

report.summary: Always propose to translate in English
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: My device and my c:geo are usually in French. I do not have the "Translate to English" menu because it is only offered when c:geo is configured to use English. Given the fact that the most used translator, Google Translate, uses English as a pivot language and may be very bad for other languages, I propose to always offer the "Translate to English" menu in addition to the local language. This has hit me in Prague where the French translation for some cache was awful.

report.summary: Clear offline logs should have confirmation
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When opening manage menu in lists clear offline logs is close to import and has no confirmation.

report.summary: have Pocket Query Creator in import menu
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: During the recent presentations I gave and also during events I notice that nearly no one knows about the Pocket Query Creator app, although it is listed in our helpers apps screen. I was wondering if we could increase the visibility by having a new menu item besides the import GPX file and import from web menu items, which would always be visible and would either invoke the pocket query creator or redirect to the market page (if not installed yet). Comments? Other ideas?

report.summary: Use event date instead of current date for logging
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I sometimes log event caches some days late. It would be more convenient to use the event date as default instead of the current date, if the cache is an event cache.

report.summary: Support OC cache size "Nano"
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: OC has an additional cache size "nano". Currently c:geo reads it as "micro" size. Example: OC100CB

report.summary: Option to 'show as list' only active when viewing live caches
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When viewing a map, one of the options is to show the visible caches as a list, however it is only active when 'enable live' is also activated AND the live feed has finished loading for the map view. As someone who predominantly uses c:geo in an offline mode, is it possible to have this feature active without the live feed? thanks.

report.summary: Send2cgeo for opencaching.pl
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From FB: is it possible to make send2c:geo compatible with polish site opencaching.pl ? it will be very usefull to polish geocachers!

report.summary: show 'Import from web' even without proper send2cgeo registration
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: It may be confusing for users that they can't find 'Import from web' entry in menu, when they don't have registered send2cgeo service. I suggest to have the entry there and show error informing user that send2cgeo is not ready to use and maybe even contain link to registration page.

report.summary: More sensible default for waypoint type on creation
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I propose to make a more sensible default for the type of a waypoint when creating a new one, depending on the type of cache: Traditional: Keep Reference point Mystery: Make „Final“ default Multi: Make „Stage of Multi“ default (or whatever the english translation is in the moment) — yes i know that then at the end you have to change to „Final“. But normally Multis have more than one stage, but only one final. Others: Don't know, perhaps you guys have ideas? Else keep „Reference Point“. I personally never need a „reference point“, and so i have to constantly change the type of waypoint when i need one. Just a small thing, but it would mean less annoyance. Thanks for considering.

report.summary: New option „Last picture taken“ when selecting picture for log upload
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Often, i take a nice picture before approaching and finding the cache, that i want to add to the cache log. When selecting a picture now you only can select between taking one right now or going to the gallery where in 99% of cases i select the last picture i took, not one from 3 months ago, that it would allow me to do…In one app i once saw an option „Last picture taken“, that automatically took the newest picture from the gallery with just one click. Perhaps this can be implemented in addition to the other two options? I suspect c:geo has to scan the DCIM-directory itself and cannot rely on delegating the task to the gallery app for that feature. Or is there an matching intent? Bonuspoints when it takes the second-to-last picture when i already uploaded the last one (when i want to upload two pictures to the same log). Thanks for considering.

report.summary: New placeholer [LOG] for twitter template
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: For sharing in twitter it is meaningful to be able to share the logtext (at least the first 140 characters) by default. This would be a new placeholder (only for twitter posts) as for the signature, inserting the logtext makes no sense.

report.summary: Personal cache notes on separate tab
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I would prefer to have my cache notes in a separate tab, so that i do not have scroll down so much in caches with very long listings, like long multis.

report.summary: Filter for "Personal Note existing"
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From support mail: When looking at a list of saved caches I can not see whether some have stored notes. I suggest to have a filter for this e.g.: Filter -> Status-> With personal note From my side I think also the alignment of icons between map and lists (another issue here) could improve the situation.

report.summary: Default TB action only for founds/attended logs
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From the german geocaching forum (translation by me): I normally use the TB visited action, but only for found and attended logs, I don't think it makes sense for other logtypes. Could you change that?

report.summary: [Feature request] Importing garmin-like spoiler images
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Garmin devices have the option of downloading spoiler images. http://garminoregon6xx.wikispaces.com/Geocaching+With+Photos These images can be batch fetched with tools like GSAK, or manually added/downloaded from coordinate checkers. They are stored as: Photos: [GPSr]\Garmin\GeocachePhotos\Last Character\Second To Last Character\Full Code\ Spoiler Photos: [GPSr]\Garmin\GeocachePhotos\Last Character\Second To Last Character\Full Code\Spoilers\ Example: Images for geocache OXZTXGC would be placed as shown: Photos: [GPSr]\Garmin\GeocachePhotos\C\G\OXZTXGC\ Spoiler Photos: [GPSr]\Garmin\GeocachePhotos\C\G\OXZTXGC\Spoilers\ c:geo should be able to import or display these spoiler images (eg. option to select directory), so that an user can manually add addition spoiler images to the cache page which are not included on the webpage.

report.summary: Avoid synchronous saving
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Blocking the UI while saving to the DB makes using c:geo tedious in several areas: working with the personal note working with waypoints offline logging it should be possible to synchronously update the cache object/UI state and do the saving to db in the background.

report.summary: Waypoint improvements
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Working with waypoints is more awkward than it should be. I propose the following changes to make the experience 'smoother': Remove the save button from edit waypoint, add save and cancel to 'action bar', make 'save' the default action on 'back' Swap short and long press in waypoint list. Short-press - edit, long-press - menu

report.summary: Opencaching.us: Api update to rev 901
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: opencaching.us updated their okapi installation to rev 901, so it can be set to current in our implementation.

report.summary: Mark saved events which have been logged "Will attend"
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From support mail: I usually have quite some event caches saved and it is hard to remember where I already posted a "Will attend". It could be an improvement to somehow mark this state in the cache list or at least the cache details (Status not "Found" but "Will attend") Remark: The feature request to include your own logs in the Friends-log tab could also be an option, as the user has a quick possibility to check what he already logged for these caches.

report.summary: send2cgeo for opencaching.nl
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: As opencaching.nl now directly uses the Polish code-base, the oc.pl script can handle oc.nl as well. It's just necessary to add the url.

report.summary: No cache size info in API from EC
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: This is no c:geo failure but an enhancement request to ec.com. I open this issue here to document the current restriction for us: The map API does not return the cache size information (the GPX however does). For me it makes sense to add this information as the c:geo users probably do not understand why the cache size is only shown for some EC-caches in a list (i.e. if the specific cache has been opened before).

report.summary: Support EC-cache attributes
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: As far as I could see from taking a look into the GPX file transfered (API) when opening an EC-cache, there is attribute information present. However it is not supported/shown in c:geo.

report.summary: Make list sorting permanent
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From support mail: Please remember "Sort By" in the lists. I usually sort by "Date stored on device" or sometimes "Favorites" and would like to keep that at least during one session or better permanently. I have to select it all the time again and again.

report.summary: Open webpage when logging caches without log support
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: For caches where our connector doesn't implement logging support, we might simply open it's web page when using the logging menu.

report.summary: Google+ cache find sharing
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: On Google+, someone requested an automatic way of sharing the found caches on Google+ as we do on Twitter and (indirectly) Facebook.

report.summary: Remember map position per session
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: A discussion on facebook brought up this proposal: Do not open the map on the current position by default, but on the last remembered map position (which is not the last remembered device position!). Because people sometimes switch between map and lists (or settings, or...) and then have difficulties finding the previous (non center) location again. As a lot of people would expect the map to open at the current position normally, this somehow needs to be tied to a "session". Such that if you use c:geo on Monday, it does not reopen at the old position on Tuesday, but on the current position. As Android does not really support this "session" concept well, I suggest to use the time delta as criteria. If the map is opened again in a time span of 1 hour, reopen the map at the last position, otherwise at the current position.

report.summary: Calendar plugin should also read short description for time
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: GC4RN8X has the time in the short description I believe

report.summary: Search bar shall match against owner
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: No description provided.

report.summary: Load Favorite Points when importing GSAK gpx
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: GSAK (Geocaching Swiss Army Knife) gpx export format supports Favorite Point counts. For big geocache lists this feature would be a very fast alternative to list refreshes. (I volunteer myself to develop this feature.)

report.summary: More extras to intent
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Add more extras (for now it is just 'latitude' and 'longitude') to intents like d/t, cachesize, waypoint name and gc-number for own extensions.

report.summary: Support coord.info/tbxxxxx trackable urls with the in-app "Geocode" scanner
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: This is a continuation of #3425 which has already been partially implemented. Currently as implemented within the app, the scanner only supports the geocaching.com url for trackables and not the shorter coord.info url. This Userscript http://userscripts.org/scripts/show/95134 now supports trackable pages using the coord.info url.

report.summary: Decrypt Waypoint Note
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Decrypt function (like clicking on a log) for waypoint notes would be very nice.

report.summary: Add ability to download/open image from cache description
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When an image is embedded in the cache description there is currently no possibility to download or open the image with another app. Only by opening the cache in the browser. You should add a long-press feature on images with the context menu choices "Download image" and "Open image". That would be really useful when trying to solve Unknown caches on the field!

report.summary: GPX Export
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When exporting to GPX, some fields are missing: FV, Found, NotFound, County, State. Child Waypoints not linked. This is when using this GPX with GSAK.

report.summary: "Long-press > Drop" missing on History List
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: In every list there is an option to long-press on a cache and select "Drop" to remove it from the list. But the History list is missing the "Drop" option. Please add the Drop option so I can remove old caches that are added due to the bug mentioned in issue #2906

report.summary: Add support for new opencaching nodes
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: List of pending sites with running OKAPI installation: opencaching.us (#3219) opencaching.nl opencaching.ro (in the final stages of getting active)

report.summary: Add ability to add waypoint from map view
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I would love a feature to add a waypoint from the map view by long pressing on a position on the map and choose "Navigate to" or "Add waypoint" in a context menu. The only way to add a waypoint today is to enter the coordinates manually or read from the Notes. This feature would be particularly useful when trying to navigate to a suitable parking place.

report.summary: Default log type "Attended" also on the day of the event
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From FB: Event caches still go to will attend even on the day of event. I thought it used to change to attended. In #2709 it was introduced that "Attended" is the default for past events. I agree that this could be extended also to cover the day of the event itself, as most people will probably log a "Will Attend" some days before and "Attended" on the very date.

report.summary: Improve contact matching
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From @YraFyra: The current implementation is first looking at the Alias field. If no match is found then DisplayName is searched. However, this search is done using the '=' thus only matching full names. I suggest to using "LIKE" as operator and "%GcAlias%" as pattern to really find the best candidates. Of course this may return more that one match and therefore I added a simple optionsmenu to select which contact to open. and let me add to this: I use to store most caching contacts in this format: Max TheCacher Mustermann or just Max TheCacher where the geocaching name (TheCacher) is either the middle name or the last name. I think some users might do alike, so I would prefer if these formats are also matched (I dont't know if this is implicit in the proposal above).

report.summary: Remember zoom level in List Map view
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I find it very annoying that the map zooms out to show all caches in the current list every time I press the Map Icon in the list view. I have to zoom in to a more suitable level to locate a nearby cache, only to get all the caches again after pressing the Map icon later. It would be great if the zoom level should be remembered from time to time when viewing the list map. You could add a "Remember Zoom Level/Show all caches" option in the Map settings menu.

report.summary: User-unfriendly interface for "any coordinate"
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: The interface for "Any destination" is not user-friendly. To make anything useful from it, one has to use the menu button. This should be made better.

report.summary: No field note export for opencaching sites
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From support mail: If I log a OP-caches offline and afterwards export the field notes the result file is empty. If I log a OP- and a GC-cache offline and export the fiels notes only the GC-cache is contained in the file. I am not familiar with the field note support on OC-sites but I can confirm the behavior (possibly the same for all non-GC caches).

report.summary: Support new cache type Giga-Event
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Example (the only one at the moment).:GC4K089 Currently parsed as "Unknown type".

report.summary: Filter for "Not found" caches missing
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Form support mail: On the list of saved caches it is possible to filter for "Found" cache but the (maybe more important) filter for "Not found" caches is missing.

report.summary: GPX parser dies on invalid character references
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Import the GPX from GC53HTM. The XML parser freaks out, as that is invalid XML (due to a bad character reference � in the file). I've been trying to remove this using a ReaderFilter as described in http://info.tsachev.org/2009/05/skipping-invalid-xml-character-with.html, but that implementation only works for invalid characters as such, not for invalid character references. Now we could implement our own character reference detection, in a FilterReader, but to me that looks like a very big gun. Does anyone see an easier solution? Just to be crystal clear: I know this is a bug on the GC.com side, but nevertheless I would like to fix it in our app.

report.summary: Copy coords from/to waypoints
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Today I wanted to copy waypoint coords from c:geo to the clipboard in order to use them for calculation in another app. It seems not to be easily possible to do that; you can actually copy either latitude or longitude (if format "plain" is selected) to the clipboard but not the whole string like it is supported for the cache coordinates itself (long click on coords). For pasting coords from clipboard into a new waypoint there is a similar "problem". If you paste them into the latitude field of course the complete string (with lat and lon) is pasted in one field which is wrong. Here some more intelligence is needed or it would need an option like "Create wapoint with clipboard content"

report.summary: Support Flashlight function
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I know, that this is not the main purpose of a geocaching app, but this request is made really often via support mail, so I would like to place it here and not simply deny a function a lot of users want to have: Have an option on the compass screen to turn on/off the camera-LED of my smartphone (e.g. a graphical button on the compass screen) I also link those users to apps supporting this via the notification screen or some key-shortcut, but I have to admit that this is probably some usage steps more than just clicking on the screen in your geocaching app. I assume there is some free code for this, so it would IMHO require just a button triggering that function?!

report.summary: Only show Changelog on startup if hash code changed
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Currently only the version code is checked to trigger opening of the changelog on app start. Additionally the hash code of the file(s) itself should be checked to only show the changelog if both conditions are met (i.e. there is something changed in the changelog). This will prevent triggering the changelog on each new NB. Thanks for the idea @Bananeweizen Assigning @rsudev as requested

report.summary: Downolad to offline use without pictures.
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: This is my first post here and firstly I would like to thank you for great free geochacing application:) Everything works fine but I miss a option to disable download a pictures for offline use. Sometimes there is a situation when I arrive first time to town with a lot of cashes around. First thing what I want to do is to fast download a caches around and go caching. Downloading with pictures (especially a lot of caches) takes quite a long time.

report.summary: Sorting of the waypoint list
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: checkout: http://www.geocaching.com/geocache/GC53NJM_circumvallatielinie-1 Watch the order of the waypoints at the bottom Now load the same cache in c:geo. Look at the waypoints, the order is different from the website. It looks like that reference points are displayed first. But in this case the reference point is a kind of "walked by"/via point, the waypoints should be kept in the website order. Maybe its not a bug but a change request (in case its intended to have a different order than the website), cannot determine that. c:geo:2014.5.14 Android:4.2.2 samsung:S3mini

report.summary: Geokrety support for OC no longer working
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: This one is difficult to describe: I am very sure, that in the past it was possible to open an OC-cache and have an inventory page shown with the listed geokrets. It was also possible to click on the inventory and see the details of the geokret. Today with 2014.06.03-NB I have seen that this is obviously no longer working. I continued and tested it with the last market release 2014.05.14, but even there it seems not to work anymore. I am unsure whether it stopped working some time before that, or it is a problem of the API or it is a problem of switching to the new API. @rsudev Possibly you are the right one to answer that. Example: OCB92E which has a virtual geokret always logged into that cache

report.summary: Geokret owner information missing
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: According to this http://geokrety.org/api.php we should be able to retrieve and show the owner of a trackable via the request we are doing to geokrety.org. Right now the owner name is shown as "Unknown" Example: Seach for Trackable GK2CBF
