report.summary: Have number of caches in dialogs
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When asking for deletion or moving of caches we should always display the number of affected caches in the confirmation dialog. That makes it more easy to be sure what will happen if filters are active and one chooses to "delete all".

report.summary: Replace menu "GPS only"
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: That has the same icon like the compass itself. Also it should be a radio button selection menu which lists all alternatives.

report.summary: Network transfer progress?
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Can we get a progress callback from our network download method? I'm currently sitting at the end of the world where sometimes there is network and sometimes there is not. So when staring at the download progress pop-up of the cache details activity I'm often wondering if my device is getting any data at all. Just displaying the number of received bytes there would really help to understand what is going on. Bonus points for getting the overall number of to be transferred bytes from the HTTP header and showing a percentage.

report.summary: New date formats on gc.com
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: According to our FAQ and my experience we support all of the date formats of gc.com except dd/MM/yyyy as we can not differentiate it from MM/dd/yyyy So we support and detect: yyyy-MM-dd yyyy/MM/dd MM/dd/yyyy dd/MMM/yyyy MMM/dd/yyyy dd MMM yy See: http://faq.cgeo.org/#1_6 Right now the amount of people having problems with log dates and contacting us has raised. I checked the website and have seen the following new(?) date formats: dd.MMM.yyyy dd.mm.yyyy Seems gc.com introduced '.' as separator as well. At least four users gave feedback, that they were actually using one of these but did not actively change to that. So might be, that they changed some defaults based on whatever rule. Shall we do anything for that? dd.MMM.yyyy should be detectable and usable, but dd.mm.yyyy is not usable I think (due to the existing mm.dd.yyyy)

report.summary: Use newer Locus API version
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Recently there was an update to Locus that apparently broke the data transfer to Locus from c:geo. We should cross-check whether there is an update to the Api or so.

report.summary: Live-map support for opencaching.org.uk
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: As oc.uk also supports OKAPI we can easily extend c:geo to cover this site as well. The implementation is already ready, it is just necessary to acquire official keys (http://www.opencaching.org.uk/okapi/signup.html) and add them to the build environment.

report.summary: Show the number of people having a cache on watchlist
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I have a feature request that I think many users are missing. As a die-hard FTF hunter it would really be great to be able to see how many that are having a cache on their watchlist. Many FTF hunters tend to place newly published caches on watchlist to be notified via email if/when the race is lost. The text in the Watchlist section might read "Cache is on your watchlist (7 in total)" or "Cache is not on your watchlist (7 in total)"

report.summary: Add support for Android Wear
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Adding support for Android Wear would be a really great feature. I'm thinking of using it's integrated compass to show to the geocache together with the phones GPS sensor. I'm not sure though how well developing for Android Wear works with Eclipse.

report.summary: Support log pictures for OC
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Users wish: Support uploading of a picture with the log like for gc.com. Don't know if OKAPI supports it.

report.summary: Reenable Samsung multi window support
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Recently we disabled Samsung multi window support as there seems to be a memory leak in some versions of Samsungs multi window feature leading to crashes when continously rotating the device while c:geo live map with mapsforge offline map is active. There was a discussion in Munich whether or not we should reenable this feature. I vote for reanabling because: It would be a feature regression if we release without that function. I know some people regularly using it (e.g. gallery and c:geo in multi window for typing in coords from pictures they took) Only a subset of devices seem to be affected (my S3 (Android 4.3) is affected, my Samsung S4 (Android 4.4.2) and my Galaxy Note 10.1 (Android 4.3) are not affected) The OOM seems only to happen when using mapsforge in combination with continous rotation (in combination with an affected device). It could be a rare case anyway. Opinions? I will meanwhile test if other apps supporting it have similar problems on my S3 (e.g. Locus).

report.summary: Support modified final coords locally for Letterbox
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From support mail: gc.com is not supporting modified coords for Letterbox caches for an unknown reason. However it could still be possible to change the listing coords locally in c:geo and only disable the upload to gc.com in that case.

report.summary: Make "Show trail" transient and disabled by default
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I'd like to make "show trail" disabled by default, and session scoped. Right now, it is enabled by default, and persistent (fortunately, to be able to get rid of it). I'd like feedback on this before going on.

report.summary: store zoom separately for live map and for "map of a single cache"
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I'm not using live map much, but today I watched a friend, who never used our app before. He was coming from live map (with a big area covered), looked at a cache and zoomed into the map of that cache very closely. When going back to the live map, it was also zoomed in closely. We should use 2 different persistent zoom states to allow more easy switching between these 2 use cases.

report.summary: Close search on click in main screen
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: No description provided.

report.summary: Option to download PQ from list
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Currently we have PQ reader, that displays 20 at the time. The most seen usecase I see from users is. They make PQ, download it, import it and then "refresh all" as PQ just does not contains all the informations a normal cacher needs in c:geo. The request is. Have an option to directly download all caches from PQ reader. Not just 20 at the time.

report.summary: Trackable last time seen doesn't use today or yesterday
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: A trackable might be shown as seen "0 days ago". This should use today and yesterday like in other places of the app.

report.summary: Reintroduce "Set destination" in compass
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I wonder if we should reintroduce the "Set destination" menu in the compass. While reworking the menus it was removed for some reason(?) but people on support and on FB keep asking for that. It seems to be more often used than we have thought as people don't want to go back and add waypoints but just continue from one navigation to another by settings a new destination directly in the compass.

report.summary: Add an icon to trackable representing "brand"
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: If GeoKrety (as of geolutins, pathtags...) are supported by c:geo, it would be good if they could be easily differentiated in cache inventory. Adding an icon representing "brand" may be an option. What's your opinion?

report.summary: Remove transparency on main screen
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: It might have seemed "cool" and "fancy" to have a transparent main screen at some point in the past, but now it brings nothing to the application and looks strange compared to what people are used to. Therefore, I propose to use a unified black or white background depending on the color scheme. Opinions?

report.summary: Use user-defined default location in absence of system location instead of Paris
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Since one of the last updates (I'm using the nightlies), quite possibly since c:geo uses Google Play Services, localization with switched-off GPS places my Live Map in France (centred on Paris, Ile-de-France). Whenever I restart c:geo, it's centred there again. Any ideas why? BTW: no Google account on this phone, does that matter?

report.summary: GeoKrety, some details are missing
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: The current implementation for viewing a GeoKrety trackable use the API brought by GK team. We use export2.php script to retrieve data. Currently we can get: gkid tracking code (when authenticated request) distance traveled lat/long current waypoint owner_id state type featured image and name missing details, like: current goal pictures gallery rate detailed logs visited countries count watching users count place visited reported missing info and maybe more... On the IRC we told "no more html parsing"... It would be cool if the GK webmasters can provide more info or API to retrieve those informations. I can send them an email, proposing to discuss about that here.

report.summary: Improve index of auto named waypoint
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: After 3ff011f has been implemented (very nice feature btw) I recognized an case at this weekend: GC27W1Y It is a multi with a predefined WP for stage 1 named Station 1 (as stage 1 is always at the listing coords but sometimes separately listed by the owner) After solving stage 1 I entered a new WP and it was autonamed Stage of a multi cache 1 but should be Stage of a multi cache 2 This is probably hard to solve automatically as the initial waypoint can have random names. I renamed the new WP Stage of a multi cache 1 manually to Stage of a multi cache 2 and saved it Afterwards I again created a new WP to enter the coords of the third stage. Now the autofill gives me 'Stage of a multi cache 1' again although Stage of a multi cache 2 already exists. Here we should not only look up whether Stage of a multi cache 1 is existing but also if other Stage of a multi cache x are existing and create Stage of a multi cache (x+1) in this case.

report.summary: Show the cache's Background Image under pictures tab
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I have a small feature request. It would be really great if the background image from the cache web page was included under the Pictures tab in c:geo.

report.summary: Allow adding favpoint in logging activity
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From support mail: Right now I have to first log the cache and afterwards add it to my favorites on another page of c:geo. It would be better to have the option to add it, right on the logging screen like it is realized on the website (and in c:geo for voting on gcvote). It somehow makes sense, to decide about favoriting the cache while logging it, rather than having to do it manually afterwards.

report.summary: "new list" in list selector drop down (new UI)
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I am not sure about the thought evolution regarding lists, I have read an older bug in may this year on this topic. Since c:geo changed interface recently, I find it much easier to change my lists, but I strongly miss the "new list" at the end of that drop down.

report.summary: Picture comments not shown
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From support mail: I have a cache where I failed due to the invisibility of an addtional info. Cache: GC47DP5 The hint picture "Hinweis wie du zu A kommst" contains a subheading. I can't find it in c:geo. I did not check where this subtitle is coming from but can confirm that we do not seem to support this.

report.summary: Use GPS in lists when in power safe mode
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When opening a list while someone else is driving, I find it very confusing how far off the shown distances are, if power safe mode is active. This fixes itself when the first cache is opened. I think it would be useful to get one GPS fix from cache list.onresume.

report.summary: Close keyboard when starting search
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Search a trackable from the action bar search. The keyboard is still visible while the progress dialog is shown. That looks not so nice.

report.summary: Insert last log text
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When I'm logging multiple trackables, then I sometimes want to repeat the log text. But typically I forget to copy it into the clipboard, while I'm logging the first one. I suggest to have a menu item "Last log text" either on the top level or behind the "Insert" menu item, which automatically puts the last used log text into the text field. Anyone with different ideas or related use cases?

report.summary: Show found state of trackable
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Is it possible to check without additional web requests whether a trackable was already discovered or otherwise logged by myself? That would be useful to avoid repeated logs of the same trackable when visiting lots of local events.

report.summary: Filter Smiley's from image tab
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: We should suppress all images from the image tab, which have only the size of a typical smiley. Example cache http://coord.info/GC5DHMW

report.summary: Support Dutch RD coordinate system
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From support mail: Currently there seems to be no offline tool which supports the Dutch RD coordinate system. In the netherlands quite some caches use this. It would be good if c:geo would also support entering coords in Dutch RD. Maybe someone come along willing to implement it. IMHO its a rare case....but I had the same problem while staying in dutch and can confirm that I did not find any tool supporting it offline on Android.

report.summary: Idea for list view
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I have no meaning yet about that, thus I want to share it with you to get feedback. From support mail: I'd like to share an idea for an update. When caches are in a list view ( near caches, saved caches) actually you can see :name, code, dimensions, D, T and distance. I think, it could be useful another row, where is listed last log info (date, log type, log user). This could be useful:in this way you can check at first sight situation of many caches at once. Instead to open each one. Hope that explain it clearly. Thanks for your work.

report.summary: Do not restrict geocaching.com geocoder to this connector
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When Google geocoder (used to transform addresses into coordinates) fails or is not installed in the phone, we resort to geocaching.com simple geocoder which returns one set of coordinates and return the caches from geocaching.com located near those coordinates. As a consequence, caches from other connectors are not fetched. When the geocaching.com connector is active, we should use its geocoder as a fallback for Google geocoder instead of a special case for loading geocaching.com caches. Also, some other geocaching sites may provide their own geocoders.

report.summary: Simple way to vote with GCVote
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: There should be a way to vote from the cache details screen, without the need to use the logging activity. It should encourage users to vote more often. E.g. we could always display the row with the own rating (instead of only when he/she already voted), and ask the user for his vote on tapping that row.

report.summary: No GPS in some views
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Google Play Services disabled Powersave mode disabled High precision is only used in some views like map, list, cache details but not in cache description, logs, etc. That is bad e.g. when you are deep in the woods and waiting for a GPS fix.

report.summary: Favor cgeo over other ways to handle cache URIs transmitted via NFC
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When cgeo is used to beam a cache to another device, we do not explicitly request that cgeo is open if present. One one of my devices, this leads to a browser being opened instead of cgeo, because I once opted out for Firefox instead of cgeo on this tablet. However, here the intention is clear: beaming from cgeo should favor opening cgeo on the remote device. We need to add an AAR (Android Application Record) to the Ndef message. I propose to include one commit (57c41e9) as soon as possible in the release, as it will not change the behavior but will ensure that explicit requests to use cgeo will be handled properly. The second commit (525d94c) will then be added to the master branch only. While this way of doing is not strictly necessary, that would allow people with version N-1 of cgeo to receive explicit beams sent by version N as well. Thoughts?

report.summary: cgeo should be able to read trackable URI from NFC
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I have written a URL for a trackable to an NFC tag but when I scan it I only get the option to open it in one of my two browsers. If I click the same link in for example an email I get the option to also open it in c:geo. As I understand this is because Android doesn't detect c:geo as capable of opening NFC url:s. I also tried writing the URL for a geocache to a NFC tag with the same result, I only get to chose one of my two browser for opening it when scanned. (I would be really neat to have this feature since the NFC tag in question is implanted in my hand and I want people to be able to log it easily with c:geo when scanning it) I found something related to this issue here: http://android.stackexchange.com/questions/84173/how-to-set-default-browser-used-by-nfc

report.summary: Add system information in "about" and mails
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: We should add more specific system information that would help us debug problems tied to specific models.

report.summary: Parsing of URLs in Personal Note
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: A lot of mysteries use a checker with a spoiler in the solution, and I copy/paste the URL of the picture in my Personal Note to retrieve it quickly when I am on the spot. But it's very annoying to copy the URL (very difficult with my fingers and the screen, and i'm not alone in my case), and then, open the browser and paste it. Can you make it clickable? Thanks!

report.summary: Add more system information
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: We should add more information to the system information which could be relevant for debugging/support and do not contain personal information. Here is my wish list: PM/BM status List of active connectors Last login result of each connector Installation status of plugins (calendar/contacts) Setting of "Hide Owned/Found" Used map strategy Language used on device Status of HW-acceleration Lineflyer: Removed one item

report.summary: Show more information if multiple contacts found
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: If a search returns more than one contact with the searched alias (name of gc-user), a dialog shows all results. In this dialog only the alias is shown, so no distinction is possible. It would be nice if more information here would be shown, for example additional first name and last name or something like displayname

report.summary: Disallow future logs
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: from facebook: avoid accidentially logging December 2015, when creating December 2014 logs in January 2015.

report.summary: Allow local change of listing coords for other cache types as well
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From support mail: Currently we disallow setting WP-coords as listing coords in general if it is not supported on the gc.com webpage for that cache type. We could instead allow at least a local modification of the listing coords in that case (as we e.g. do for OC mystery caches).

report.summary: Add shortcuts to caches
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: We can already create shortcuts on request from the standard widget creation of android. If our app had an additional permission then we could create home screen shortcuts to caches directly from the menu of a cache. What do you think about that?

report.summary: URLs for most opencaching.* sites are not recognized by cgeo
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: opencaching.{de,fr} is supported, but opencaching.us is not for example. They should be added to the AndroidManifest.xml and handled properly.

report.summary: Have compass menu in map of single cache
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: No description provided.

report.summary: Show offline log as topmost log in logbook
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: If an offline log exists, then it should be shown as the topmost log entry (independent of the date), to make the user more easily aware of that existing log. Clicking that log should lead straight to the log editor.

report.summary: "Your saved log" should have orange marker
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: @Bananeweizen Small addition to #4679: The shown offline log should have an orange marker in the logbook instead of the default marker for the log type posted. This would make it consistent to the list view and would draw users attention to this log.

report.summary: Use second line in map title
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When opening a map with a real action bar then we should move the cache numbers into a second line similar to the cache list.

report.summary: Sort by name automatically
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: We are already have a mechanism which will sort lists containing only events by date automatically instead of by distance. I was wondering if we could similarly detect that all caches have a common prefix (i.e. belong to a series) and in that case sort by name by default. Does anyone see a problem with that? If not, I may try implementing this.

report.summary: For single map cache show T/D in subtitle
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When running the map with a single cache we can use the subtitle for additional information like d and t.

report.summary: Map title should more accurately reflect what is visible
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When opening a map, it gets an initial title which does not change afterwards. But several options menus make the map behave totally different. Therefore on activating the "live" option, the map should call itself "life map" on disabling the "live" option, the map should call itself "map". This is most confusing when the map was started from a list, where it (correctly) takes the list title initiallly.

report.summary: Eclipse: make missing `final` a fatal error for cgeo sources
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I have made missing final qualifiers in parameters, fields and local variables a fatal error in IntelliJ IDEA. Some Eclipse user should do the same there. Best done in the release branch, then merged into master.

report.summary: Make heading line optional
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From support: Ever since this new update 3/28/15, when I push navigate, there is a thick irritating stright red line from my present position aiming at and all the way to the geocache where I want to go. I do not want it there! It is distracting and gets in the way of reading Street names and other things. How can I make it go away? I looked at settings and do not know how to disengage it. Maybe it is a Google map thing and has nothing to do with c:geo. Any helpful advice is welcomed.

report.summary: Toast when saving on back
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I like the new design of the edit waypoint activity. But I think some users may be confused if waypoints change, when using back (or up navigation). We should show a toast about the change, if the activity is not left using the explicit okay or cancel buttons.

report.summary: `Missing` status for GK should be represented
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: GK provide the information with the /export.php API (the script is announced as "slow and large volume of data") GKM /export-details.php provide the missing status in standard. We may render the status as: strikethrough the trackable name in the cache inventory list activity. Name could also be strikethrough on the Trackable detail activity

report.summary: Support SSL for GK connection when possible.
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: GeoKrety.org provides SSL support, but they're certificate is self signed.. :/ Should I try to 'auto-accept' the "bad" certificate, or continue to not use SSL? GeKretyMap.org provides SSL, but our current Network library doesn't support SNI (#4991). Note: Already discussed on #4778 To sum up. @rsudev: I would definitely vote for trying to use SSL, because even with a self-signed certificate we get encryption. @samueltardieu: only if it doesn't make us accept any certificate, because we check the certificate for a number of sites already (extremcaching.com, geocaching.com, open.mapquestapi.com) and I would not want to allow MITM for those. GeoKrety.org GeoKretyMap.org

report.summary: Be more explicit in system information when no connectors are active
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: The absence of any active connector shows in the system information by not showing anything. It should be more explicit and says that no connector has been enabled.

report.summary: Copy coords from waypoints
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: It is possible to paste coords to wayponts. See #3799 But there is no way afaik to copy cords FROM waypoints. I find a need for this very often when I want to share coordinates with friends on the fly. One possible implementation of this might be to add a "Copy coords" option to the long-press menu of a waypoint. Another would be a "Share coords" option that presents a list of possible Share providers like on the Share Cache option.

report.summary: TrackableActivity has not refresh button
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: It would be cool to have a button to refresh a displayed trackable in the TrackableActivity.

report.summary: Show logbook of GK trackable
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Of course this feature request was mentioned by OC-users looking at the new Geokret functionality: The logbook of GK trackables should be loaded as well (like for GC trackables). I don't know whether the API supports that currently, so I just want to file that as a Feature Request here.

report.summary: GPS off mode should be tied to "Use Low power" in TB activity
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: as it has been done recently in 944f4e5 for the CacheDetailActivity. See #4575

report.summary: Allow upload of personal note to OC server
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: This seems to be supported with the OKAPI and should be implemented identically to the gc.com feature: http://www.opencaching.de/okapi/services/caches/save_personal_notes.html

report.summary: Optionally keep GPS always on
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Recently the disabling of GPS in some views was modified to be applied only in "Low power mode" to allow users to keep a GPS fix as long as c:geo is running (as it might take some time depending on the device to re-fix GPS). Still quite some users ask for keeping the GPS also if: Screen is locked c:geo is active in the background So this is feature request (I checked but did not find a matching issue) to "keep the GPS-lights on while c:geo is started" as an additional option in the System settings.

report.summary: attachments (e.g. images) for caches
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: It would be great to attach data e.g. images to a cachelistings in c:geo. Locus owns this feature already and I think c:geo needs it too.

report.summary: Remove trail feature
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I suggest that we remove the trail feature due to severe limitations: It doesn't work correctly, if the screen is off. It has a restricted buffer size (so it cannot track multiple hours). It looses the trail when reopening the map. There are many more explicit tracking apps. E.g. I have Endomondo tracking my geocaching walkings through the forest. 👍 1 👎 7

report.summary: Have export menu in cache activity
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: People should be able to export a single cache to gpx from the cache activity.

report.summary: Geocaching.com Messagecenter Support (Feature Request)
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I would be glad if CGEO support the Message Center on geocaching.com. The app could check for new messages when you get anything downloaded from geocaching.com. Since the number of new messages is a part of every page. 👍 1

report.summary: Moving caches by selection mode
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: This should not be possible

report.summary: Spotted field is wrong for GKs
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: 2015.05.18-NB Open GKC240 The "spotted" field shows "in GC1HKWQ" but in fact the GK was only visited there and is still with a user (with myself). For a GC trackable the user name of the curent holder is shown in such a case. Not sure whether this is a bug or a different function at GK.

report.summary: Back from waypoint editor should not save automatically
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I know we discussed this briefly somewhere. Now I crosschecked with current release and new relase candiate (with modified waypoint layout): On the current release 2015.03.31 pressing back while editing the waypoint discarded the changes. With 2015.05.29-RC pressing back will save changes made I think we should either adopt the old working mode (don't save on back) or preferably show a dialog with "Save" or "Discard" options.

report.summary: Question / Improvement: is there a way to check its personal TB/GK inventory within cgeo?
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Hi, I'm wondering if it's possible for a user to check is personal TB/GK inventory within the apps? As far as I know yet, you could only simulate to log a cache and there you see inventory. Thanks,

report.summary: LogTrackableActivity should provide autocomplete on 'geocode' field
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: As it's available with the quick search on the main activity, direct logging a GK should provide autocomplete on 'geocode' field. search for a GeoKret open logging page choose 'discovered' logtype start typing in the 'geocode' field -> autocomplete should start.

report.summary: View all waypoints of a cache in an external app
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From support mail: Currently I can map a list of caches in an external app (like Locus or maps.me). Great feature! (Map - Menu - Show on map - ) The same thing should be possible from the waypoint tab of a cache to get all its waypoints shown on the external app.

report.summary: Combine send2cgeo scripts into one script
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I just recognized that we did not yet officially publish the send2cgeo script for OC. While thinking about how to do that, I had the idea that there might be no need to have to seperate scripts but just one which triggers for both websites. Is that technically possible? Having a combined script would minimize the effort (one version handling, one send2cgeo.html page on the website, etc.).

report.summary: have send2cgeo work on project-gc.com
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I would like to have send2cgeo to work on project-gc.com 👍 1

report.summary: Use text watcher to format coordinate input
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Similar to how phone numbers are formatted in edit texts we should add leading or trailing zeros automatically in the coordinate fields. I have been quite confused again by our non mathematical minute fraction part.

report.summary: New button "Move" in already stored cache pop-up window
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Hi. It is a kind of usability improvement. When I click a cache on map that is already stored on some list I wish to have "MOVE" button. I do not need to click "More details" then, in order to move cache from one list to another.

report.summary: Support import of GGZ files
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From support mail: Some applications (like GSAK and Garmin tools) support a compressed GPX format named GGZ. While this officially is a propriertary solution for Garmin devices, it seems to be just a zipped GPX with a small folder structure inside (containing a XML file specific to Garmin(?) and a normal GPX). As it seems to be a valid ZIP archive, might it be possible to enable c:geo to import that on the same way as GPX (and zipped GPX). Advantage for the user: Have only one small file valid for his Garmin and c:geo (which is in fact the same device=Monterra). Example file: https://www.dropbox.com/s/xbl6ma64f6dcpg2/test.ggz If you just remane that to *.zip you will be able to open it.

report.summary: Use one dialog for username and password
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: For services which need username and password, we should use a single dialog combining both. This should help in getting the credentials right for new users.

report.summary: Automatically check login after first credentials supplied
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: For a new installation, we should automatically trigger the "check login" functionality after the login credentials for geocaching.com have been supplied. The login needs to be executed anyway during the next steps to get some data, but it would be good to detect errors early, while the user is still in the settings.

report.summary: OC Cachelist import
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I request a new feature wich can import cachelist from opencaching.de It would be great to import GPX on my c:geo. Cachelists may be available by OKAPI. Save my own list or public listings on c:geo. Thanks! You will find any support at OC you need ;)

report.summary: Open opencaching id-urls with cache/by_url method
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Some cache links from opencaching are sent suing the internal cache id instead of the waypoint (geocode). With the OKAPI-method 'by_url' it is possible to resolve those as well.

report.summary: Support import of personal notes from GCComment
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: It would be cool if c:geo could import comments from GCComment. Since I am not a Premium Member at Groundspeak anymore, it has become indispensable for me. But I always missed the the sync of them to c:geo. GCComment GCComment is browser extension for managing your personal cache notes for basic and premium members (option to sync them with GS's personal notes). It also advantages compared to GS's personal notes: no char limit, additional coords, ... I'm not initiator of the script, but I try to fix bugs and keep the development going. In my branch I've created a version with the possibility to share comments as links (gist based). This version is not ready for release yet (some little thing are missing), but it's working. The gist export could be basis for an import in c:geo. Links There are 3 types of links: single cache: http://gcc.lukeiam.de#gcc77f77058034820de51e1 (id starts with gcc and is 23 chars long) If you cut of the gcc from the id you get the gist id where the data is stored: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/77f77058034820de51e1 multiple caches: http://gcc.lukeIam.de#gccce2836e0154de67363c1f (id starts with gccc and is 24 chars long) Cut of the gccc from the id you get the gist id again: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/e2836e0154de67363c1f static link to multiple caches: All other links change with each export, but the static links can be resolved to the last multiple caches export of the user. (If the user agreed with uploading his ids - It uses a little web service hosted on azure) http://gccs.lukeIam.de#23788787-7b74-459b-96b3-3773eca8f5a6 (other subdomain and id contains - and is 36 chars long) Use this id and call https://idresolver.azurewebsites.net/23788787-7b74-459b-96b3-3773eca8f5a6 and you will get a multiple caches id: "gccce2836e0154de67363c1f" Data The data is encoded in xml and can be parsed easily. See the links above for examples. Gist API Gist has an easy to use REST-API to download the data: https://developer.github.com/v3/gists/ c:geo integration It would be cool to support two methods: Import with qr code by url (using intent-filter?) Save the static url in the options and import frequently or on request I could write some java code to help, but I'm quite new to android. If you need more information or if I could help somewhere, let me know...

report.summary: Possibility to filter caches with no "found" logs in an offline list
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I did not see this filter in an offline list : considering and filtering caches with zero found log (as possible FTF to do). Of course, this is the cache state according to the last refresh, but it's user responsibility to update it. I know this has been already asked with a marker on a map, but the cache details are not downloaded in this case, so it has no sense. But in an offline list, we have these logs. The filter would just check if there is at least one "found" log. What do you think about it ?

report.summary: Support loading existing log pictures
report.label: Feature Request

Is something wrong here or is it really that we never supported it?

report.label: Feature Request

It's rather annoying to still have the searchBar open with keyboard shown. It would be better to have the main screen clean. (That's already the case, when you select a cache/trackable from the proposed results.)

report.summary: Remove gc-based address search
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Groundspeak has asked us to remove gc-based address search, as they will get charged for that in the future (see mail in g+ developer group). Already since some time we primarily use Android or Mapquest for geocoding, but gc is still there as a fall-back.

report.summary: Support GeoLutins trackables
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Long time ago I've contacted David, the GeoLutins owner, asking him if he agree with an integration of GL in c:geo. He replied yesterday, and was enthusiast. He proposed a simple API to lookup GL. He also added a GL[0-9AZ]{5,} pattern to lookup GL. The c:geo icon was added on his website just near this "new GL numbers" http://www.geolutins.com/profil_geolutin.php?ID_Geolutin_Selectionne=1976. Is there a problem with that? Main API url, is as of today: http://www.geolutins.com/xml/api.php?G=GLXXXXX There is also a converter from Tracking Numbers to GL numbers: http://www.geolutins.com/xml/decode.php?G=00000000-000 ( [0-9]{8}-[0-9]{3} ) I've done a proof of concept, I still need to clean a bit the code.

It would be much more convenient to also have an "Ready" button on the top of the window. See explanation: I like this suggestion!

(it once looked like that)

So the name could be shown in the import window header or at least the "import done" window should state the file name which has just been imported.

report.summary: Improve coord parsing from personal note
report.label: Feature Request
report.description:
..or improve it to make it more reliable. Several users contact us regularly having problems with strange waypoints automatically created by parsing of the personal note. There seem to be cases, where we parse nonsense. One example I received today: Personal note content: A=6 B=0 C=5 D=4 E=13
N 48° 53.(A*C*E)+194 E 009° 11.((D*71)-0)-1 N 48° 53.(6*5*13)+194 E 009° 11.((4*71)-0)-1 N 48° 53.(390)+194 E 009° 11.((284)-0)-1 N 48° 53.584 E 009° 11.283 c:geo creates the following waypoint as parsing result: N 48° 53,000 E 006° 00,000 This means users might see a lot of incorrect waypoints on their map without a possibility to permanentely remove them. So I suggest to either improve the parsing or add an option to disable it in general so that affected users have a solution.

report.summary: links not working in waypoint hints
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: GC39Y48 has a link in the test waypoint. It's not working.

report.summary: Improve PQ selection usability
report.label: Feature Request

report.summary: support encrypted logs
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: from facebook: Does cgeo automatically decode encrypted logs? I have permanently encrypted a log entry on one of my caches as it gave clues to the cache location. On the web page the entry appears encrypted but cgeo shows it in plain text. GC59E5Z, log entry for 27 Aug 15 This is because we use the "Decrypt" button functionality when fetching logs. It should be possible rather easily to instead fetch the non decrypted JSON. I'm just wondering if we would need a new database column for log entries. To my mind it should in principle not matter for our app whether the stored log text is actually encrypted or not. Clicking it in the UI will just toggle, independent of whether we known its state. Am I right with that concept? If so, we could probably just pimp the JSON parser.

report.summary: Pocket Query list: show last generated and remaining days

report.summary: Allow to update Header-Coordinates for Letterbox and Wherigo Caches
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: The finals of a Letterbox and Wherigo Caches could have other coordinates as the header coordinates from their listings. So it should be possible to enter these coordinates so that g:geo treat them as header coordinates. At the moment it is also possible to send these coordinates to geocaching.com as corrected coordinates for the listing. These seems to be a breach in the website. The impementation of this feature request is a simple one-liner in the source file EditWaypointActivity, in the current revision the line 207 have to be changed.

report.summary: Add trackable brand to activity
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Right now it is impossible to tell if a trackable opened from search is either travel bug or geokrety or geolutin. As there are users which don't want to register at all sites, we should make it possible to recognize very easily to which site/brand this trackable belongs. @kumy maybe this is of interest for you, since you changed a lot around trackables?

report.summary: Locally changed coords replaced by listing coords on refresh
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open a saved cache Create a waypoint, select to change coords locally to listing coords Refresh the cache Actual behaviour after performing these steps: The local change is lost and replaced again by the listing coords retrieved during refresh Expected behaviour after performing these steps: As the user defined change was done, it is not correct that this data is lost by refreshing. Not all users will understand this in beforehand and loss of data will appear. Version of c:geo used: 2016.02.23-RC Is the problem reproducible for you: Yes Attach system information if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System): Not relevant Other comments and remarks: Follow up of #5439 Comment by @blochi79: Now we have a follow problem. ;-( The local header coordinates are overwritten if the cache is refreshed. The method for refreshing a cache needs also to be adapted for the case that the local header coordinates have been corrected. Then the original coordinates in waypoints must be updated with the Listing coordinates instead of the header coordinates. [...] I often perform bulk refresh of mixed lists that contains also traditional caches. In this case I don't want to lose the corrected coordinates of letterbox or Wherigo caches. I did not know that it is the default behavior of c:geo to overwrite the local corrected coordinates with the listing coordinates. I think the current issue can be closed and the behavior of overwriting corrected coordinates while refreshing a cache may be discussed as subject of another issue. Sorry for the confusion.

report.summary: Show geotagged log or listing images on the map

Twitter still shown as authorized in settings Expected behaviour after performing these steps: This should be detected (if possible), the user notified and the stored authorization should be revoked Version of c:geo used: 2016.02.03 Is the problem reproducible for you: Yes (under the mentioned conditions) Other comments and remarks: Log: 22:09:15.248 Warning cgeo 7216 [AsyncTask #5] 403 [Forbidden] (403 ms) POST https://api.twitter.com/1.1/statuses/update.json 22:09:15.248 Error cgeo 7216 [AsyncTask #5] Tweet could not be posted. Reason: HTTP/1.1 403 Forbidden [cache-control: no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate, pre-check=0, post-check=0, content-disposition: attachment; filename=json.json, content-type: application/json;charset=utf-8, date: Sun, 06 Mar 2016 21:09:15 GMT, expires: Tue, 31 Mar 1981 05:00:00 GMT, last-modified: Sun, 06 Mar 2016 21:09:15 GMT, pragma: no-cache, server: tsa_o, status: 403 Forbidden, strict-transport-security: max-age=631138519, x-access-level: read-write, x-connection-hash: b19230bade95cc6affd2b3181485e2af, x-content-type-options: nosniff, x-frame-options: SAMEORIGIN, x-response-time: 136, x-transaction: baed1ecc1b734226, x-tsa-request-body-time: 0, x-twitter-response-tags: BouncerCompliant, x-xss-protection: 1; mode=block]

report.summary: Send installer package name to status manager

We can retrieve the name of the application that installed the current application from the package manager. report.summary: Coords not sendable to mapy.cz

The problem is that when you send those coordinates, mapy.cz will only show a label (picture) without a pin with exact position (picture). And I would like to point out that it has to work offline as well. It would really make user experience better not only for me, but for many Czech geocachers. Keep up the good work! report.summary: Support ignoring and watching caches
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: It should be possible to watch or ignore OC cache listings with the same UI as for gc.com caches. API: http://www.opencaching.de/okapi/services/caches/mark.html

report.summary: feature request: option to allow caches in only 1 list
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Feature request: add an option to bring back the old behaviour for the lists: each cache can only be part of 1 list. (an option, because I do understand the new way of handling lists and its advantages for lots of users.) Use case: create a pocket query (or run an existing one) and add the caches to a new list. A couple of days later you run the same PQ and also add those to a new list. So you get 2 lists with caches. Best after new caches became part of the new list, or other ones removed, etc. old behaviour: The new list has the number of caches included in the PQ, the old one only lists those caches that aren't included anymore (disabled, found, new caches made them disappear etc.) It is easy to look at those and decide which ones to keep or remove. new behaviour: You get 2 lists with no easy way of telling the difference. If you want to make sure you don't have caches on the device which are not useful anymore, you can only clear the old list. It is possible you clear caches that can still be useful for future trips. In my case I create one using pocket query creator every couple of days, or before I go geocaching, with only the 1000 closest enabled caches that are active and haven't been found be me. With the old behaviour I ended up with up to 3-4 lists with caches, I only had to remove those I found or were disabled. I do not log with c:geo on the device I have with me on trips, so found caches are not marked as found on that device and it also doesn't have an internet connection during trips.

report.summary: Close cache selection by tapping outside
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: When you tap on an area where there are sevaral caches located (new map) a list for selecting one of them pops up. It should be possible to close this by tapping outside the list, as with the popup itself, not only through the back button. 👍 1

report.summary: Remember last list selection
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Sometimes I store caches one by one from the live map. Every time I have to select the same list(s) again and again. Previously we had the "ask for list" option, now I suggest to add an option to remember the last list selection for storing a cache. This is somehow related to the requested long-press in #5839 as it removes the additional work for selecting a list.

report.summary: Brouter does not work on new map
report.label: Feature Request

report.summary: use cache icon in logging activity
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Use the cache icon instead of the normal icon for the logging activity. Requested during an event. There might be more activities where this would be useful.

report.summary: Export OC caches in field notes
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Currently the field notes feature is tested on opencaching.de and will be released soon. c:geo does not export logs of OC caches.

report.summary: Use status.cgeo.org instead of the Heroku address
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Heroku now lets us use a SSL certificate for our custom domain (status.cgeo.org). We got one from StartSSL and installed it for API calls. In order to be able to migrate away from Heroku to a hosted server, we now need to replace API calls from https://cgeo-status.herokuapp.com to https://status.cgeo.org. After this, we can freely move status.cgeo.org to another host. Note that older installations using the Heroku address will be able to be redirected using the Free plan since they will not use our custom domain when talking to Heroku.

report.summary: Support user modified coords from/to server for all cache types
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: According to the latest release notes gc.com now supports this function for all cache types, thus c:geo should do.

report.summary: Personal Note on own tab
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I would love to have (on a per cache option) the Personal Note on a own tab (site?). Especially on long multicaches (example: GC1K0FM) it is unpractical to always scroll down to note the value of the next stage and go back and search for the description of the next stage. Great would be to just swipe left and right to switch between the two views like switching to the logs works. There could be a "edit in separate tab" button below the current edit button.

report.summary: Remove fastest strategy on live map
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I suggest to remove the selectable live map strategy for the following reasons: Users I spoke with are not even aware of this option Users I spoke with always prefer to see the cache type and get most information out of the map Networks have become faster There are often users on support and in ratings claiming that they only see ?? caches as they accidentally selected "Fastest" thinking it would be the same but just faster Make things simpler, less options The speed dependent solution (Current default) should be the fixed strategy. 👍 3

report.summary: Have a link to Project-GC for challenge caches
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Idea: If cache type is Mystery, platform is GC and title contains "Challenge" have a menu item "Search challenge checker" which directs to http://project-gc.com/Challenges/GCCODE

report.summary: Add geochecker link also for gc-apps.com
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Curently we provide a menu item "Open Geochecker" if the cache listing contains a checker link. Since some months there is a new officially allowed checker of www.gc-apps.com We should also scan for their links and make the menu item working for that. Example: GC3EQ4W

report.summary: Add filter "With personal data - with own waypoints"
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Please add personal filter "with own waypoints". Now there are "with personal note", "with modified coordinates" but no possibility to find the cache with additional custom waypoints

report.summary: Feature request - creating new caches
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Sorry in advance if duplicate. Is it possible to add possibility for creating new caches? For example, now when I want to create a cache, I record all points with coordinates as a waypoints of some other cache and use them for creating new cache at home. I think it may be convenient to have ability to create a cache just from c:geo (with possible following posting to the Geocaching website(s)). What do you think?

report.summary: Handling of non-detailed saved caches
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: [22:03] IMHO we should ask the user or directly download the details if he opens a nondetailed cache This is possible from live map popup of a previously offline logged cache or from history of an offline logged caches. Reference to #6231

report.summary: The Log Date Format in System Information does not always provide the intended information
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Problem: The Log Date Format actually displays the current date formatted with the date format in use. On some dates, it will not be possible to infer the date format in use. On, say, February 2, the Log Date Format could be displayed as 02/02/2017, but it is not possible to infer which of the formats DD/MM/YYYY or MM/DD/YYYY was actually used. This feature was implemented in commit 8ad942f Solution: Display the actual format string, like DD/MM/YYYY, or, if that is not feasible, use a fixed example date which makes it possible to infer the date format, like December 14 2013.

report.summary: Extract waypoint function should provide result
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: After executing the function "Extract waypoints" it might or might not be succesful in extracting waypoints. It also happend to me, that it took some time until the extracted waypoints finally showed up in the waypoint tab (I suspect the process was still running while swiping to the waypoint tab). We should provide a feedback to the user about the result of the extraction. This could be done with a small toast like "Extracted x waypoints from cache description" / "No wapoints found in cache description"

report.summary: Have "Add Waypoint" on top
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: If you are adding a lot of waypoints for a (multi)cache newly created waypoints are at the bottom of the list with the add button below the list. To add a new waypoint you always have to scroll down (swipe up) first to access the "Add waypoinr"-button. Same goes to access (or use) a newly created waypoint. Suggestion is to create a setting to show waypoints in reverse chronological order (newest on top), with the "Add waypoint"-button right above the list, or not (as it currently is).

report.summary: Sort trackables on log page by code rather than by name
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Received by a user: [...]would it be possible to list the trackable inventory by tracking code? Right now, it is listed in alphabetical order with the code below it. The only issue, especially when you move many trackables like myself, most of the time the user doesn't know the name of the trackable, only knows the code. So putting the codes alphabetically would be amazing and much faster. I never thought about that, but I fully agree. If I put trackables into the cache I always look for its tracking number and sorting by that would indeed make this more easy. Maybe we could also put it into the first row (bigger font) and the name into the second row (smaller font) or make both lines with same font size. ❤️ 1

report.summary: Duplicate waypoint from within a waypoint should open the duplicated one
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open the details of a server defined waypoint Click on the coordinates Select "Duplicate waypoint" Actual behavior after performing these steps: A toast is shown that the waypoint has been duplicated but the screen still shows the server waypoint While this is logical for itself, the user expectation might be different. Expected behavior after performing these steps: As the user clicked on the coords he most likely wants to enter new coords (we recently blocked this for server defined WPs for a good reason), so we should directly take him to the copied waypoint as he selected to duplicate it. Right now he has to leave the WP detail view, scroll and search for the duplicated WP, enter the WP details and then finally edit the coords. Version of c:geo used: 2017.02.23-NB1 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: I would like to get your opinion on how this should work. 👍 1

report.summary: Add option to copy user name
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open detail page of a cache Click on owner name Actual behavior after performing these steps: A menu with many options is shown, however simply copy the user name is missing Expected behavior after performing these steps: Add an menu entry to copy the owner name Version of c:geo used: 2017.02.23-NB1 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes/No System information: Attach system information here if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> Swipe right to System) Keep the apostrophe at beginning and end to have it properly formatted Other comments and remarks: Same for all other menus, where the user can click on a users name (e.g. logbook)

report.summary: Allow copying waypoint description text
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: With recent changes we disallowed editing the waypoint text of server waypoints. At least we should allow copying the text to clipboard (via long click on it), so that the user can reuse e.g. contained formulas, etc.

report.summary: GSAK First log
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Hi, Cgeo remove the first log created by GSAK when user refresh caches. This first log contains personnal notes, it is alway the first log of the cache in the GSP created by GSAK. The user is always GSAK. Would it be possible to keep this log even after a refresh ? Detailed steps causing the problem: GSAK : Create some caches with personnal notes GSAK : Export GPX with options - include user notes in export - Extra informations to show in first log = %UserNote CGEO : Import the GPX (i put a gpx as attachement) CGEO : You can see the notes in first log of caches CGEO : Refresh all caches CGEO : The log created by GSAK as been removed Gpx.zip Many thanks for your software Best regards Pierre

report.summary: Proposed restructuring of the cache list menu
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Detailed description of the problem: Adding new functions to the cache list causes a growing of the menu. Issue #6528 asks for a new functionality which adds an additional menu item. In that issue I suggested a restructuring of the main cache list menu. Actual behaviour: A lot of menu items... Suggestion: Restructuring of the menu like this: Show on map Filter Sort Switch select mode Invert select mode Manage cashes ** Refresh all / selected ** Move all / selected ** Copy all / selected ** Remove all / selected ** Delete offline-logs ** Delete past events Manage lists ** Create new list ** Remove current list ** Rename current list ** Make list unique Import ** Import GPX ** Import from send2cgeo ** Import from Android Export ** Export GPX ** Field notes ** Personal notes Remove from history

report.summary: Add .nomedia to GeocacheData dir
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: There are some users on social media and support mail asking us, why suddenly they do see a large amount of geocaching related pictures in their gallery apps. It seems, that some gallery apps also scan below /Android/data for media files and thus show them in the overview. I am not sure, if there is any standard or guideline if these folders should be scanned for media (e.g. on my S7 the default gallery app is not showing them). We could think about placing a .nomedia file into the base dir of GeocacheData. What do you think?

report.summary: Raise note length limit to 2500 characters
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: -Download or write a personal Note ( with morge the 500x charactars edit it, make it longer, what do you want. reupload it too the server Actual behavior after performing these steps: When the note is longer then 500x characters c:geo open a popup window and tell you that the personal note will cut off by the geocaching.com server after 500x characters . Expected behavior after performing these steps: the popup window should only open when he note is longer then 2500x characters and then to tell you that the note will be cut off by the geocaching.com server after 2500x characters. Version of c:geo used: 2017.04.27-RC and 2017.05.22 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: Groundspeak has made an update to the personal note system and raised the max charakters from 500x to 2500x charakter. Is it possible to show the counted charaters of the personalnote field in the top of the edit field ( beside the close/save icon) like (1478 / 2500) ? greetings from germany Marco / Wulfman_Do

report.summary: Feature Request: multi user / switch user
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: As I just learned it is not possible anymore for a owner to log "Needs Maintenance" (NM) for his own geocaches. Therefore I registered a second account on geocaching.com which I want to use only to log NM. Also, my girlfriend has her own account, and sometimes, when she forgot to take her mobile phone with her, she wants to use my phone to log a geocache. But of course she doesn't remember her password. Would it be possible to add a multi user feature and make it possible to switch users fast and simple by selecting a user from a list of saved users within cgeo? Thanks, Christian 👎 2

report.summary: Switch crowdin access to https://api.crowdin.com
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: I received the following announcement from crowdin: Hello, This is Andriy from Crowdin team, hope you are fine! Our developers have notified me that according to our database records, some API calls sent for the project(s) listed below lead to http://api.crowdin.net endpoint instead of https://api.crowdin.com : c:geo In a week, we're planning to perform a redirect to https://api.crowdin.com when the request is sent to http://api.crowdin.net or https://api.crowdin.net . It should not cause any issues with API communication, but still that would be great if you could verify your current configuration On July 25th, http://api.crowdin.net and https://api.crowdin.net are planned to be competely disabled and thus it's strongly recommended to switch to https://api.crowdin.com beforehand to prevent any pauses with your Crowdin integration. Kindly check this inquiry with your development team Should you have any questions or need further assistance, you are welcome to reach me directly. Thanks! -- Sincerely, Andriy Poznakhovskyy, Head of Customer Success, Crowdin beacon

report.summary: Only unstored caches on live map view are stored in selected list
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Zoom into an area on the live map where you have both stored and unstored caches Choose Store Offline in menu Create a new list or select an existing list Actual behavior after performing these steps: Only the caches that are not already stored in any other lists are added to the new list. The cache with the offline log is also added to the new list, even if it has a "stored" icon Expected behavior after performing these steps: All caches in the map view should be added to the new list. Since several lists can co-exist nowadays the already stored caches should be added to the new list as well. Version of c:geo used: 2017.07.26-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes

report.description: The import menu should contain an option to open a list with all downloadable PQ. The selected PQ should be imported to the active list (or open the dialog with the active list pre-selected). 👍 1

report.summary: Support Android Auto
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: As this questions keeps coming in on support mail now regularly, I wanted to open this issue to get feedback and maybe also learn what would be needed to support Android Auto. I have no experience myself with Android Auto. Does this need a dedicated app or plugin or is it some other interface?

report.summary: Merging the existing waypoint note with the new note in the calculator
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: From #6704 Interesting. I thought temporarily about linking the 'Calculator notes' with the 'waypoint notes' (or 'user notes') but didn't end up giving it much thought and just implemented a 3rd 'notes' field exclusively for the calculator. Would you find it more useful to have these notes merged in some way? If so I'll look at it as another ticket. Yes, I see no benefit having two separate notes. I feel it as an disadvantage to not see the calculator notes in the waypoint overview. If the calculator is used this usually contains information (e.g. variables and formulas) which might be interesting for other waypoints, too.

report.summary: Disable phone number linking in personal notes
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: We use linking in the personal notes to detect hyperlinks that may be in there. However, given that personal notes often contain values for mystery caches, the phone number linking kicks in for every 2+ digit number in the personal notes as an unwanted side effect. It would be nice if we could still have hyperlinks detected, but suppress phone number detection at the same time.

report.summary: Implement Tri-State Calculator Buttons
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Just making this ticket as a way to track the suggestion that @pstorch made in #6704 that: I'm thinking about if we should change the button modes. With a short press it toggles between variable and original value. Maybe it should also toggle through the "space" case. So that this feature is more accessible. If that comment doesn't quite make sense out of context what @pstorch is suggesting is: Perhaps rather than simply having the calculator buttons toggle between 'Input-value" and "Auto-char" (with the blank option being available by entering SPACE through a long press) that the calculator buttons have three states, being "Input-value", "Auto-char" and "Blank". Note that the "Custom-char" functionality will still be available through a long press, it just won't be the way you "blank-out" buttons.

report.summary: Allow non-standard letters to be use in equations
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: This is just being created in order to track the discussion in #6773 about allowing non-standard letters to be used in equations. @rsudev commented: A-Z (if that really is the definition) is less ambiguous than LETTER (which in some places might end up being äöü or even åđžć ... and @UniQP said: I would prefer to allow all characters accepted by Character.isLetterOrDigit(...) and simply use letter and digit in the message. Is that feasible? And later on @pstorch commented: Regarding the letter and digit discussion: at the moment it is ambiguous. Just tried ö, which is a letter, and got the above error message. I personally think we should restrict the variable letters to A-Z. If we allow all unicode letters from all languages, then we might run into sorting issues again. So, to avoid that and make things simple, I would suggest A-Z letters only. What do you think?

report.description: As discussed in the original proposal for the calculator only single character 'labels' fit on the buttons requiring intermediary 'names' to be used: However, in 'Plain' format we do not have such size restrictions, so allowing direct entering of bracketed expressions should be possable:

report.summary: add D/T rating to log signature
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: Feature Request As a geocacher I want to include the D/T rating of the current Cache in my log signature as template variable. Like this I am aware of D/T rating changes between the date I found the cache (created an offline log) and the date I log the cache. This might be important when logging several caches for a challenge cache (having stored offline logs and the rating changed afterwards). I want to be aware of D/T rating changes between the date I found the cache (created a offline log) and the date I log the cache. This might be important when logging several caches for a challenge cache (having stored offline logs and the rating changed afterwards). Acceptance Criteria when I click on "settings/logging/signature/insert template" I can choose "Difficulty" from the drop down. when I click on "settings/logging/signature/insert template" I can choose "Terrain" from the drop down. having selected "Difficulty" "[DIFFICULTY]" has been added to my signature. having selected "Terrain" "[TERRAIN]" has been added to my signature. selecting "Log visit" on a Cache inserts my signature having e.g. "[DIFFICULTY]/[TERRAIN] replaced with the according rating (e.g. "D3/T4") for a D3/T4 cache.

report.summary: Implement "Result Highlighting" in the Calculator.
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: As mentioned in #6716 (Managing ambiguous results in WP Calc where trailing/leading zeros are involved) it can be necessary to insert additional zeros into the result of a formulation, and in some instances there is contention as to whether these should be 'leading-zeros' or 'trailing-zeros'. It has been suggested that a method of identifying how a result has been manipulated would be desirable and a suggestion made is to colour the 'manipulated' digits differently to provide this indication: Developer notes: Implementing this is not as trivial as one might at first think for a few reasons: The main concern is that the text to display for a valid location is actually obtained from the waypoint itself rather than from the input strings used to create it. This is done specifically so that users can be aware of exactly what the resulting waypoint will actually represent rather than their entered value (which may result in something they did not expect). Although we have access to both the input string and the resulting GeoPoint's string displaying a 'diff' of these two strings is not as trivial as you may think. However, once it is known what colours should be used for each letter actually displaying the desired results shouldn't be too hard given TextView's support the use of HTML strings. Further notes: Once implemented this "Syntax Highlighting" would be most useful in conveying information to users of what leads to "Parsing Failures" (as related to #6802: Coordinate Parser Needs Work).

report.summary: Confirmation before discard waypoint changes
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: It's annoying when you have entered a lot of data for a waypoint and accidentally press back. Currently everything is lost. c:geo should show a confirmation instead. 👍 3

report.summary: Provide a way to delete coordinates from waypoints
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: This was already discussed at the end of #6697. There are various ways you can get unwanted coordinates in a waypoint: you just want to add a note there you prepare waypoint calculator formulas in advance In all these cases arbitrary coordinates (usually your current position) are stored into the waypoint and there is no way to get them removed again. This has different disadvantages: you cannot distinguish between a waypoint with correct or incorrect coordinates it pollutes the waypoint map with wrongly placed waypoints This is of course more problematic for caches with lots of stages: you get a wild mixture of valid and arbitrary coordinates. Therefore it would be nice to have an action to remove waypoint coordinates from a waypoint. The implementation for this is trivial. It acts in the same way as the "Delete" action in the waypoint context menu. This means, there is no confirm dialog and there is no different behavior for user created waypoints or listing waypoints. The latter can be restored by a cache refresh again. I will share my changes tonight. 👍 2

report.summary: Present Disable/Archived Log at top of Geocache listing
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: With this change #6866 GS presents the disabled and archived logs at the top of the geocache page. It's a very useful information for users to see right away what's wrong with the cache. Suggestion is that we also add this to the top of the geocache details activity. What do you think?

report.summary: Support Mirrorlink
report.label: Feature Request
report.description: This request from support mail is similar to #6684 but aims not to use Android Auto (which we learned is no real option) but support Mirrorlink. I did not yet take a closer look about the requirements to support this and if it may be meaningful.
